sentences.zh: 太史公讀秦記，至犬戎敗幽王，周東徙洛邑，秦襄公始封為諸侯，作西畤用事上帝，僭端見矣。

translations.literal: When the Grand Historian read the Qin records, reaching the point where the Quanrong defeated King You and Zhou moved east to Luoyi, Duke Xiang of Qin was first enfeoffed as a feudal lord, built the Western Altar to serve the Supreme Deity—the first signs of presumption appeared.
translations.idiomatic: When the Grand Historian read the Qin Records and came to the passage where the Quanrong defeated King You and the Zhou moved east to Luoyi—whereupon Duke Xiang of Qin was first enfeoffed as a feudal lord and established the Western Altar to serve the High God—he saw the first signs of presumption.

sentences.zh: 《禮》曰：「天子祭天地，諸侯祭其域內名山大川。」

translations.literal: The Rites say: 'The Son of Heaven sacrifices to Heaven and Earth, feudal lords sacrifice to the famous mountains and great rivers within their domains.'
translations.idiomatic: The Rites states: "The Son of Heaven sacrifices to Heaven and Earth; the feudal lords sacrifice to the renowned mountains and great rivers within their own domains."

sentences.zh: 今秦雜戎翟之俗，先暴戾，後仁義，位在藩臣而臚於郊祀，君子懼焉。

translations.literal: Now Qin mixed the customs of the Rong and Di, putting violence and tyranny first, benevolence and righteousness after. Though positioned as a vassal minister, they performed suburban sacrifices—the gentlemen were alarmed.
translations.idiomatic: Yet Qin, mingling the customs of the Rong and Di, reveled in harshness and tyranny before speaking of benevolence and righteousness. Though it stood as a border vassal, it presumed to take part in the suburban rites; any gentleman would be uneasy.

sentences.zh: 及文公踰隴，攘夷狄，尊陳寶，營岐雍之閒，而穆公修政，東竟至河，則與齊桓、晉文中國侯伯侔矣。

translations.literal: When Duke Wen crossed the Long mountains, drove back the Yi and Di barbarians, honored Chen Bao, and camped between Qi and Yong, Duke Mu repaired his government, his eastern border reached the Yellow River, and thus he equaled the central states' feudal lords like Duke Huan of Qi and Duke Wen of Jin.
translations.idiomatic: When Duke Wen crossed Mount Long, drove back the Yi and Di, honored the Bao of Chen, and established himself between Qi and Yong—and when Duke Mu set his government in order and pushed his eastern frontier to the Yellow River—Qin could match the hegemonic lords of the Central States, such as Duke Huan of Qi and Duke Wen of Jin.

sentences.zh: 是後陪臣執政，大夫世祿，六卿擅晉權，征伐會盟，威重於諸侯。

translations.literal: After this, attendants took charge of government, grand officers held hereditary stipends, the six ministers monopolized Jin's power, conducting campaigns and alliances, their authority greater than the feudal lords.
translations.idiomatic: After that, mere retainers held the reins of government; great officers drew hereditary stipends; and the Six Ministers usurped Jin's authority, leading campaigns and convening alliances, their power weighing heavier than that of the feudal lords.

sentences.zh: 及田常殺簡公而相齊國，諸侯晏然弗討，海內爭於戰功矣。

translations.literal: When Tian Chang killed Duke Jian and became minister of state of Qi, the feudal lords sat by in complacent calm and did not punish him; within the seas, all contended for merit in war.
translations.idiomatic: When Tian Chang murdered Duke Jian and took control of Qi as its chief minister, the other lords looked on and did nothing. From then on, the realm competed only for victories in war.

sentences.zh: 三國終之卒分晉，田和亦滅齊而有之，六國之盛自此始。

translations.literal: The three states finally divided Jin, Tian He also extinguished Qi and possessed it—the flourishing of the six states began from this time.
translations.idiomatic: In the end, the Three Houses divided Jin, and Tian He likewise overthrew Qi and made it his own. The ascendancy of the Six States began here.

sentences.zh: 務在彊兵并敵，謀詐用而從衡短長之說起。

translations.literal: Their efforts were devoted to strengthening their armies and annexing their rivals; stratagems and deception were employed, and doctrines of vertical and horizontal alliances, of weighing what was long and short, arose from this.
translations.idiomatic: Their whole endeavor was to build strong armies and swallow their rivals. Trickery became policy, and the rhetoric of the Vertical and Horizontal alliances—of weighing gains and losses—sprang up.

sentences.zh: 矯稱蜂出，誓盟不信，雖置質剖符猶不能約束也。

translations.literal: False claims and pretexts swarmed like bees; oaths and covenants could not be trusted. Even exchanging hostages and splitting tallies still could not restrain them.
translations.idiomatic: Empty claims multiplied by the day, and oaths and alliances meant nothing. Even hostages and the splitting of covenant tallies could not hold anyone to an agreement.

sentences.zh: 秦始小國僻遠，諸夏賓之，比於戎翟，至獻公之後常雄諸侯。

translations.literal: Qin began as a small, remote state; the various Xia polities treated it as an outsider, comparing it to the Rong and Di. Only after Duke Xian did it repeatedly dominate the feudal lords.
translations.idiomatic: Qin began as a small and distant state, regarded by the Xia polities as a peripheral guest and counted among the Rong and Di. Yet after Duke Xian it rose again and again to overawe the other lords.

sentences.zh: 論秦之德義不如魯衛之暴戾者，量秦之兵不如三晉之彊也，然卒并天下，非必險固便形勢利也，蓋若天所助焉。

translations.literal: Discussing Qin's virtue and righteousness as inferior to the violent tyranny of Lu and Wei, measuring Qin's troops as not as strong as the three Jins, yet in the end it united all under Heaven—not necessarily because of dangerous fortifications, convenient terrain, or advantageous positions, but rather as if Heaven assisted it.
translations.idiomatic: One might say that Qin's claim to virtue and righteousness did not even equal the brutality of Lu and Wei, and that its armies were weaker than those of the Three Jin states. Yet Qin still ended by uniting the realm. This cannot be explained solely by rugged passes, stout walls, or favorable ground—it was as if Heaven itself had aided it.

translations.literal: When the Grand Historian read the Qin records, reaching the point where the Quanrong defeated King You and Zhou moved east to Luoyi, Duke Xiang of Qin was first enfeoffed as a feudal lord, built the Western Altar to serve the Supreme Deity—the first signs of presumption appeared. The Rites say: 'The Son of Heaven sacrifices to Heaven and Earth, feudal lords sacrifice to the famous mountains and great rivers within their domains.' Now Qin mixed the customs of the Rong and Di, putting violence and tyranny first, benevolence and righteousness after. Though positioned as a vassal minister, they performed suburban sacrifices—the gentlemen were alarmed. When Duke Wen crossed the Long mountains, drove back the Yi and Di barbarians, honored Chen Bao, and camped between Qi and Yong, Duke Mu repaired his government, his eastern border reached the Yellow River, and thus he equaled the central states' feudal lords like Duke Huan of Qi and Duke Wen of Jin. After this, attendants took charge of government, grand officers held hereditary stipends, the six ministers monopolized Jin's power, conducting campaigns and alliances, their authority greater than the feudal lords. When Tian Chang killed Duke Jian and became chancellor of Qi, the feudal lords were complacently undisturbed, all under Heaven contended for military achievements. The three states finally divided Jin, Tian He also extinguished Qi and possessed it—the flourishing of the six states began from this time. Their efforts were devoted to strengthening troops and uniting against enemies, and the sayings of scheming, deception, and the vertical and horizontal alliances of long and short arose from this. False pretenses swarmed like bees, oaths and covenants were not trusted, even placing hostages and splitting tallies could not bind them. Qin began as a small, remote country, the various Xia treated it as a guest, compared it to the Rong and Di, until after Duke Xian it constantly dominated the feudal lords. Discussing Qin's virtue and righteousness as inferior to the violent tyranny of Lu and Wei, measuring Qin's troops as not as strong as the three Jins, yet in the end it united all under Heaven—not necessarily because of dangerous fortifications, convenient terrain, or advantageous positions, but rather as if Heaven assisted it.

sentences.zh: 或曰「東方物所始生，西方物之成孰」。

translations.literal: Some say 'Eastern things begin life there, western things mature there.'
translations.idiomatic: Some have said: "In the east, things are born; in the west, things come to maturity."

sentences.zh: 夫作事者必於東南，收功實者常於西北。

translations.literal: Those who set enterprises in motion must do so in the southeast; those who reap their solid achievements are usually in the northwest.
translations.idiomatic: To begin an undertaking, one must start in the southeast; to harvest its fruits, one most often ends in the northwest.

sentences.zh: 故禹興於西羌，湯起於亳，周之王也以豐鎬伐殷，秦之帝用雍州興，漢之興自蜀漢。

translations.literal: Thus Yu rose from the Western Qiang, Tang arose from Bo, Zhou's kings used Feng and Hao to attack Yin, Qin's emperors used Yong province to rise, Han's rise came from Shu and Han.
translations.idiomatic: Thus Yu rose among the Western Qiang; Tang arose at Bo; the kings of Zhou attacked Yin from Feng and Hao; the Qin emperors rose by relying on Yongzhou; and the Han rose from Shu and Hanzhong.

translations.literal: Some say 'Eastern things begin life there, western things mature there.' Those who initiate affairs must do so in the southeast, those who gather actual merit are constantly in the northwest. Thus Yu rose from the Western Qiang, Tang arose from Bo, Zhou's kings used Feng and Hao to attack Yin, Qin's emperors used Yong province to rise, Han's rise came from Shu and Han.

sentences.zh: 秦既得意，燒天下詩書，諸侯史記尤甚，為其有所刺譏也。

translations.literal: Qin, having achieved its ambitions, burned the poems and documents of all under Heaven, the feudal lords' historical records especially so, because they contained criticisms.
translations.idiomatic: Once Qin had achieved its ambitions, it burned the Songs and Documents of the realm—most of all the historical records kept by the feudal states, because those texts contained barbs and criticism.

sentences.zh: 詩書所以復見者，多藏人家，而史記獨藏周室，以故滅。

translations.literal: The reason the Songs and Documents have reappeared is that they were extensively stored in private households, while the historical records were stored only in the Zhou court, and for this reason they were extinguished.
translations.idiomatic: The Songs and Documents survived because they had been preserved in many private homes, but the historical records were kept only by the Zhou court and were therefore destroyed.

sentences.zh: 惜哉，惜哉！

translations.literal: What a pity! What a pity!
translations.idiomatic: How lamentable, how lamentable!

sentences.zh: 獨有秦記，又不載日月，其文略不具。

translations.literal: Only the Qin records survived, but again they do not record the days and months, their text is brief and not complete.
translations.idiomatic: Only the Qin records remained, but they lack dates and their text is too concise and incomplete.

sentences.zh: 然戰國之權變亦有可頗采者，何必上古。

translations.literal: However, the stratagems and expedients of the Warring States also have some that are quite worthy of adoption, why must it be ancient times?
translations.idiomatic: Yet the stratagems and expedients of the Warring States era also contain much that is worth adopting—why limit ourselves to ancient times?

sentences.zh: 秦取天下多暴，然世異變，成功大。

translations.literal: Qin took the world through much violence, however the world changes with time, the success was great.
translations.idiomatic: Qin conquered the world through much brutality, yet times change and circumstances alter, and its success was monumental.

sentences.zh: 傳曰「法後王」，何也？

translations.literal: The tradition says 'Follow the later kings', why is that?
translations.idiomatic: The tradition states: "Follow the later kings." Why is that?

sentences.zh: 以其近己而俗變相類，議卑而易行也。

translations.literal: Because they are close to our own age and the transformations of customs resemble each other, their doctrines are humble and easy to implement.
translations.idiomatic: It is because the later kings are closer to our own era, and their customs and transformations resemble our own, that their doctrines are humble and easy to follow.

sentences.zh: 學者牽於所聞，見秦在帝位日淺，不察其終始，因舉而笑之，不敢道，此與以耳食無異。

translations.literal: Scholars are bound by what they have heard, see Qin in the imperial position for few days, do not examine its beginning and end, therefore laugh at it altogether, do not dare to speak—this is no different from eating with the ears.
translations.idiomatic: Scholars are constrained by what they have heard. They see that Qin held the imperial throne for only a short time, fail to examine its full course from beginning to end, and so laugh it off entirely while not daring to speak of it. This is no different from accepting hearsay as truth.

sentences.zh: 悲夫！

translations.literal: Alas!
translations.idiomatic: How sad!

translations.literal: Qin, having achieved its ambitions, burned the poems and documents of all under Heaven, the feudal lords' historical records especially so, because they contained criticisms. The reason the poems and documents reappeared was that many were hidden in people's homes, but the historical records were stored only in the Zhou court, so they were destroyed. Alas, alas! Only the Qin records remained, but they did not record dates and months, their text was brief and incomplete. Yet the stratagems and changes of the Warring States also have much worth adopting—why must it be ancient times? Qin took the world with much violence, yet eras change, great success was achieved. The tradition says 'Follow later kings,' why is that? Because they are close to us and their customs and changes are similar, their doctrines are humble and easy to implement. Scholars are constrained by what they have heard, seeing Qin in the imperial position for few days, not examining its beginning and end, so they laugh at it, not daring to discuss it—this is no different from eating with the ears. How lamentable!

sentences.zh: 余於是因秦記，踵春秋之後，起周元王，表六國時事，訖二世，凡二百七十年，著諸所聞興壞之端。

translations.literal: I therefore used the Qin records, following after the Spring and Autumn Annals, beginning from King Yuan of Zhou, recording the affairs of the six states during that time, ending with the Second Emperor, altogether two hundred seventy years, writing about the principles of rise and decline that I have heard.
translations.idiomatic: Therefore, I drew upon the Qin records to continue after the Spring and Autumn Annals. Beginning with King Yuan of Zhou, I recorded the affairs of the Six States era and ended with the Second Emperor—a span of 270 years total—setting down the principles of rise and decline that I have heard about.

sentences.zh: 後有君子，以覽觀焉。

translations.literal: Later gentlemen may view and observe it.
translations.idiomatic: May future gentlemen view and observe this.

translations.literal: I therefore followed the Qin records, continued after the Spring and Autumn Annals, beginning from King Yuan of Zhou, chronicled the affairs of the six states, ending with the Second Emperor, altogether 270 years, recording the causes of rise and fall that I have heard. May future gentlemen use this to observe and reflect.

sentences.zh: 公元前

translations.footnote: Translator's note: This column does not appear in Sima Qian's original text. It is added here for convenience.
translations.literal: Before the common era
translations.idiomatic: BCE

sentences.zh: 周

translations.literal: Zhou
translations.idiomatic: Zhou

sentences.zh: 秦

translations.literal: Qin
translations.idiomatic: Qin

sentences.zh: 魏

translations.literal: Wei
translations.idiomatic: Wei

sentences.zh: 韓

translations.literal: Han
translations.idiomatic: Han

sentences.zh: 趙

translations.literal: Zhao
translations.idiomatic: Zhao

sentences.zh: 楚

translations.literal: Chu
translations.idiomatic: Chu

sentences.zh: 燕

translations.literal: Yan
translations.idiomatic: Yan

sentences.zh: 齊

translations.literal: Qi
translations.idiomatic: Qi

cells.idiomatic: First year of Duke Li Gong.

cells.literal: Xian Zi. Duke Chu of Wei Zhe, first year after.
cells.idiomatic: Xian Zi. First year after Duke Chu of Wei, Zhe.

cells.literal: King Hui Zhang, thirteenth year. Wu attacked us.
cells.idiomatic: King Hui Zhang, thirteenth year. Wu attacked us.

cells.literal: Two. People from Shu came to present tribute.
cells.idiomatic: Second year. People from Shu came to offer tribute.

cells.literal: Fourteen. Yue surrounded Wu, Wu resented.
cells.idiomatic: Fourteenth year. Yue surrounded Wu, Wu resented it.

cells.literal: Duke Chu of Jin Cuo, first year.
cells.idiomatic: First year of Duke Chu of Jin, Cuo.
Seventh year. The Yue people first came.

cells.literal: Five. Chu people came to present tribute.
cells.idiomatic: Fifth year. People from Chu came to offer tribute.

cells.literal: Seventeen. Marquis Jing of Cai died.
cells.idiomatic: Seventeenth year. Marquis Jing of Cai died.

cells.literal: Nine. Zhi Bo Yao of Jin came to attack us.
cells.idiomatic: Ninth year. Zhi Bo Yao of Jin came to attack us.

cells.literal: Six. Yiqu came to present tribute. Mian Zhu begged for aid.
cells.idiomatic: Sixth year. The Yiqu came to offer tribute. Mian Zhu sought aid.

cells.literal: Eighteen. Marquis Sheng of Cai, first year.
cells.idiomatic: Eighteenth year. First year of Marquis Sheng of Cai.

cells.content: 衛出公飲，大夫不解襪，公怒，即攻公，公奔宋。
cells.literal: When Duke Chu of Wei was drinking, the grandees did not remove their socks. The Duke was enraged, immediately attacked the grandees, and the Duke fled to Song.
cells.idiomatic: When Duke Chu of Wei was drinking, the grandees did not remove their socks. The Duke was enraged, immediately attacked the grandees, and the Duke fled to Song.

cells.literal: Nineteen. Prince Zi Ying fled to Qin.
cells.idiomatic: Nineteenth year. Prince Zi Ying fled to Qin.

cells.content: 十。庶長將兵拔魏城。彗星見。
cells.literal: Ten. The Supreme Commander led troops and captured a Wei city. Comet appeared.
cells.idiomatic: Tenth year. The Supreme Commander led troops and captured a Wei city. A comet appeared.

cells.literal: Twenty-two. Duke Ai of Lu died.
cells.idiomatic: Twenty-second year. Duke Ai of Lu died.

cells.content: 二十三。魯悼公元年。三桓勝，魯如小侯。
cells.literal: Twenty-third. Duke Dao of Lu, first year. The Three Huan were victorious, Lu became like a small marquess.
cells.idiomatic: Twenty-third year. First year of Duke Dao of Lu. The Three Huan were victorious; Lu became like a small marquess.

cells.content: 知伯伐鄭，駟桓子如齊求救。
cells.literal: Zhi Bo attacked Zheng, Si Huan Zi went to Qi to seek aid.
cells.idiomatic: Zhi Bo attacked Zheng; Si Huan Zi went to Qi to seek aid.

cells.content: 五十四。知伯謂簡子，欲廢太子襄子，襄子怨知伯。
cells.literal: Fifty-fourth. Zhi Bo told Jian Zi that he wished to depose Crown Prince Xiang Zi, whereupon Xiang Zi came to resent Zhi Bo.
cells.idiomatic: Fifty-fourth year. Zhi Bo told Jian Zi that he wished to depose the Crown Prince Xiang Zi, whereupon Xiang Zi came to resent Zhi Bo.

cells.literal: Duke Xiao of Yan, first year.
cells.idiomatic: First year of Duke Xiao of Yan.

cells.content: 十七。救鄭，晉師去。中行文子謂田常：「乃今知所以亡。」
cells.literal: Seventeenth. Having rescued Zheng, the Jin armies withdrew. Zhonghang Wen Zi said to Tian Chang: 'Only now do I understand why we were destroyed.'
cells.idiomatic: Seventeenth year. Having rescued Zheng, the Jin armies withdrew. Zhonghang Wen Zi said to Tian Chang: 'Only now do I understand why we were destroyed.'

cells.literal: Fourteenth. Jin people and Chu people came to present tribute.
cells.idiomatic: Fourteenth year. The Jin people and Chu people came to offer tribute.

cells.literal: Duke Ai of Zheng, first year.
cells.idiomatic: First year of Duke Ai of Zheng.

cells.content: 十六。塹阿旁。伐大荔。補龐戲城。
cells.literal: Sixteenth. They dug a trench at Apang. Attacked Dali. Repaired the city of Pangxi.
cells.idiomatic: Sixteenth year. They dug a trench at Apang, attacked Dali, and repaired the city of Pangxi.

cells.literal: Twentieth. The Duke led the army and fought with Mian Zhu.
cells.idiomatic: Twentieth year. The Duke led the army and fought with Mian Zhu.

cells.content: 襄子。元年未除服，登夏屋，誘代王，以金斗殺代王。封伯魯子周為代成君。
cells.literal: Xiang Zi. First year mourning not yet ended, ascended the Summer House, lured the King of Dai, killed the King of Dai with a gold ladle. Enfeoffed Bo Lu Zi Zhou as Lord Cheng of Dai.
cells.idiomatic: Xiang Zi. In the first year, while mourning had not yet ended, he ascended the Summer House, lured the King of Dai, and killed the King of Dai with a gold ladle. He enfeoffed Bo Lu Zi Zhou as Lord Cheng of Dai.

cells.literal: Thirty-two. Marquis Sheng of Cai died.
cells.idiomatic: Thirty-second year. Marquis Sheng of Cai died.

cells.literal: Duke Ai of Jin Ji, first year.
cells.idiomatic: First year of Duke Ai of Jin, Ji.

cells.literal: Thirty-three. Marquis Yuan of Cai, first year.
cells.idiomatic: Thirty-third year. First year of Marquis Yuan of Cai.

cells.literal: Duke Dao of Wei Qian, first year.
cells.idiomatic: First year of Duke Dao of Wei, Qian.

cells.literal: Duke Xuan of Qi ascended throne first year.
cells.idiomatic: First year of Duke Xuan of Qi's ascension to the throne.

cells.literal: Four. With Zhi Bo divided Fan, Zhonghang lands.
cells.idiomatic: Four. Divided the territories of Fan and Zhonghang with Zhi Bo.

cells.literal: Wei Huanzi defeated Zhi Bo at Jinyang.
cells.idiomatic: Wei Huanzi defeated Zhi Bo at Jinyang.

cells.literal: Han Kangzi defeated Zhi Bo at Jinyang.
cells.idiomatic: Han Kangzi defeated Zhi Bo at Jinyang.

cells.content: 五。襄子敗智伯晉陽，與魏、韓三分其地。
cells.literal: Five. Xiangzi defeated Zhi Bo at Jinyang, with Wei, Han divided his territory into three parts.
cells.idiomatic: Five. Xiangzi defeated Zhi Bo at Jinyang and divided his territory into three parts with the Wei and Han families.

cells.content: 二十五。晉大夫智開率其邑來奔。
cells.literal: Twenty-five. Jin official Zhi Kai led his city to come submit in flight.
cells.idiomatic: Twenty-five. The Jin official Zhi Kai led his city in flight to submit.

cells.literal: Twenty-six. Left Chamberlain walled Chengnan Zheng.
cells.idiomatic: Twenty-six. The Left Chamberlain built walls at Chengnan Zheng.

cells.literal: Five. Duke Jing of Song died.
cells.idiomatic: Five. Duke Jing of Song passed away.

cells.literal: Duke Jing of Wei first year.
cells.idiomatic: First year of Duke Jing of Wei.

cells.literal: Thirty-nine. Marquis Qi of Cai first year.
cells.idiomatic: Thirty-nine. First year of Marquis Qi of Cai.

cells.literal: Six. Duke Zhao of Song first year.
cells.idiomatic: Six. First year of Duke Zhao of Song.

cells.literal: Twenty-eight. Yue people came to welcome woman.
cells.idiomatic: Twenty-eight. People of Yue came to welcome the woman.

cells.literal: Duke Cheng of Yan first year
cells.idiomatic: This was the first year of Duke Cheng of Yan's reign

cells.content: 二十九。晉大夫智寬率其邑人來奔。
cells.literal: Twenty-nine. Jin official Zhi Kuan led his townspeople to come submit in flight.
cells.idiomatic: Twenty-nine. The Jin official Zhi Kuan led his townspeople in flight to submit.
Forty-two. Chu destroyed the state of Cai.

cells.literal: Forty-four. Extinguished Qi. Qi was Xia's descendant.
cells.idiomatic: Forty-four. The state of Qi was destroyed. Qi was a descendant of the Xia dynasty.

cells.literal: Thirty-three. Attacked Yiqu, captured their king.
cells.idiomatic: Thirty-three. The army attacked the Yiqu tribe and captured their king.

cells.literal: Thirty-four. Solar eclipse, daytime darkened. Stars appeared.
cells.idiomatic: Thirty-four. There was a solar eclipse that darkened the daytime sky. Stars became visible.

cells.literal: Duke Zhao of Qin first year
cells.idiomatic: This was the first year of Duke Zhao of Qin's reign
This was the first year of King Kao's reign

cells.literal: Duke You of Jin Liu first year. Subjugated Han, Wei.
cells.idiomatic: First year of Duke You of Jin's reign. He subjugated the states of Han and Wei.

cells.literal: Eight. Sixth month, rain snow. Sun, moon eclipses.
cells.idiomatic: Eight. In the sixth month, there was rain and snow. Both solar and lunar eclipses occurred.
This was the first year of Duke Min of Yan's reign
This was the first year of Duke Zhao of Wei's reign

cells.literal: Chu King Jian Zhong first year. Extinguished Ju.
cells.idiomatic: First year of King Jian of Chu's reign. The state of Ju was destroyed.

cells.content: 十三。義渠伐秦，侵至渭陽。
cells.literal: Thirteen. Yiqu attacked Qin, invaded to Weiyang.
cells.idiomatic: Thirteen. The Yiqu tribe attacked Qin and invaded as far as Weiyang.

cells.literal: Three. Lu Duke Dao passed away.
cells.idiomatic: Three. Duke Dao of Lu passed away.

cells.literal: Qin Duke Huai first year. Gave birth to Ling Gong.
cells.idiomatic: First year of Duke Huai of Qin's reign. Duke Ling was born.

cells.literal: Four. Lu Duke Yuan first year.
cells.idiomatic: Four. First year of Duke Yuan of Lu's reign
This was the first year of King Weilie of Wei's reign

cells.content: 四。庶長晁殺懷公。太子蚤死，大臣立太子之子，為靈公。
cells.literal: Four. Chamberlain Quan killed Duke Huai. Crown prince died young, ministers established crown prince's son as Duke Ling.
cells.idiomatic: Four. Chamberlain Quan assassinated Duke Huai. The crown prince died young, so the ministers installed the crown prince's son as Duke Ling.

cells.literal: Wei Dao Gong Min first year.
cells.idiomatic: This was the first year of Duke Dao of Wei's reign

cells.literal: Qin Ling Gong first year. Gave birth to Xian Gong.
cells.idiomatic: First year of Duke Ling of Qin's reign. Duke Xian was born.

cells.literal: Wei Wen Hou Si first year.
cells.idiomatic: This was the first year of Marquis Wen of Wei's reign
This was the first year of Viscount Wu of Han's reign
This was the first year of Zhao Jianzi's reign

cells.literal: Two. Zheng You Gong first year. Han killed him.
cells.idiomatic: Two. First year of Duke You of Zheng's reign. Han assassinated him.
This was the first year of Marquis Xian of Zhao's reign
Three. The upper and lower altars were constructed.

cells.content: 三。鄭立幽公子，為繻公，元年。
cells.literal: Three. Zheng established Duke You's son, made him Duke Xu, first year.
cells.idiomatic: Three. Zheng installed the son of Duke You as Duke Xu, first year of his reign.

cells.content: 五。魏誅晉幽公，立其弟止。
cells.literal: Five. Wei executed Duke You of Jin, established his younger brother Zhi.
cells.idiomatic: Five. Wei executed Duke You of Jin and installed his younger brother Zhi as duke.

cells.content: 六。晉烈公止元年。魏城雍梁。
cells.literal: Six. Jin Duke Lie Zhi first year. Wei walled Yong Liang.
cells.idiomatic: Six. First year of Duke Lie of Jin's reign. Wei built walls around Yongliang.

cells.literal: Seven. Fought with Wei at Shaoliang.
cells.idiomatic: Seven. Fought a battle with Wei at Shaoliang.

cells.content: 八。城塹河瀕。初以君主妻河。
cells.literal: Eight. Walled and moated along riverbank. First time offered lord's wife to river.
cells.idiomatic: Eight. Built walls and moats along the riverbank. For the first time, offered the ruler's wife as sacrifice to the river.
Eight. Rebuilt the city of Shaoliang.

cells.content: 十。補龐，城籍姑。靈公卒，立其季父悼子，是為簡公。
cells.literal: Ten. Repaired Pang, walled Jigu. Duke Ling died, established his youngest uncle Dao Zi, this was Duke Jian.
cells.idiomatic: Ten. The city of Pang was repaired and walls were built around Jigu. When Duke Ling died, they installed his youngest uncle Dao Zi as Duke Jian.
This was the first year of Duke Jian of Qin's reign

cells.literal: Eleven. Wei Shen Gong first year.
cells.idiomatic: Eleven. First year of Duke Shen of Wei's reign

cells.literal: Ten. Zhongshan Wu Gong first established.
cells.idiomatic: Ten. Duke Wu of Zhongshan was first established.

cells.literal: Two. Fought with Jin, defeated at Zhengxia.
cells.idiomatic: Two. Fought a battle with Jin and was defeated at Zhengxia.

cells.content: 四十三。伐晉，毀黃城，圍陽狐。
cells.literal: Forty-three. Attacked Jin, destroyed Huang city, besieged Yanghu.
cells.idiomatic: Forty-three. Attacked Jin, destroyed the city of Huang, and besieged Yanghu.

cells.content: 十三。公子擊圍繁龐，出其民。
cells.literal: Thirteen. Prince Ji besieged Fan Pang, expelled its people.
cells.idiomatic: Thirteen. Prince Ji besieged Fan Pang and expelled its population.

cells.literal: Forty-four. Attacked Lu, Ju and Anyang.
cells.idiomatic: Forty-four. Attacked the states of Lu and Ju, as well as Anyang.
Thirteen. Built walls around the city of Pingyi.
Forty-five. Attacked Lu and captured the city of Du.
Five. There was a solar eclipse.

cells.literal: Six. First ordered officials to wear swords.
cells.idiomatic: Six. For the first time, officials were ordered to wear swords.

cells.literal: Sixteen. Attacked Qin, built Linjin, Yuanli.
cells.idiomatic: Sixteen. Attacked Qin and built the cities of Linjin and Yuanli.

cells.literal: Seven. Trenched Luo, walled Chongquan. First taxed grain.
cells.idiomatic: Seven. Dug trenches at the Luo River and built walls around Chongquan. For the first time, grain was taxed.

cells.content: 十七。擊守中山。伐秦至鄭，還築洛陰、合陽。
cells.literal: Seventeen. Attacked defended Zhongshan. Attacked Qin to Zheng, returned built Luoyin, Heyang.
cells.idiomatic: Seventeen. Attacked and defended Zhongshan. Invaded Qin territory as far as Zheng, then returned and built the cities of Luoyin and Heyang.

cells.content: 韓景侯虔元年。伐鄭，取雍丘。鄭城京。
cells.literal: Han Jing Hou Qian first year. Attacked Zheng, captured Yongqiu. Zheng walled Jing.
cells.idiomatic: First year of the Marquis Jing of Han's reign. Attacked Zheng and captured Yongqiu. Zheng built walls around Jing.

cells.content: 趙烈侯籍元年。魏使太子伐中山。
cells.literal: Zhao Lie Hou Ji first year. Wei sent crown prince to attack Zhongshan.
cells.idiomatic: First year of Marquis Lie of Zhao's reign. Wei sent its crown prince to attack Zhongshan.
Forty-eight. Captured the city of Cheng from Lu.

cells.content: 十八。文侯受經子夏。過段干木之閭常式。
cells.literal: Eighteen. Wen Hou received classics from Zi Xia. When passing Duan Gan Mu's gate always bowed.
cells.idiomatic: Eighteen. Marquis Wen received instruction in the classics from Zi Xia. Whenever he passed Duan Gan Mu's gate, he always bowed.

cells.literal: Two. Zheng defeated Han at Fushu.
cells.idiomatic: Two. Zheng defeated Han at Fushu.

cells.content: 楚聲王當元年。魯穆公元年
cells.literal: Chu Sheng Wang Dang first year. Lu Mu Gong first year
cells.idiomatic: First year of King Sheng of Chu's reign. First year of Duke Mu of Lu's reign

cells.content: 四十九。與鄭會于西城。伐衛，取毌。
cells.literal: Forty-nine. Met with Zheng at Xicheng. Attacked Wei, captured Gu.
cells.idiomatic: Forty-nine. Met with Zheng at Xicheng. Attacked Wei and captured the city of Gu.

cells.literal: Twenty. Divined chancellor, Li Ke, Zhai Huang contended.
cells.idiomatic: Twenty. Divined for a chancellor; Li Ke and Zhai Huang contended for the position.

cells.literal: Fifty-one. Tian Hui with Linqiu rebelled.
cells.idiomatic: Fifty-one. Tian Hui rebelled from Linqiu.

cells.literal: Qi Kang Gong Dai first year.
cells.idiomatic: This was the first year of Duke Kang of Qi's reign.
Twenty-two. He first became a marquis.
Six. He first became a marquis.
Six. He first became a marquis.

cells.literal: Five. Wei, Han, Zhao first ranked as lords.
cells.idiomatic: Five. Wei, Han, and Zhao first ranked as feudal lords.

cells.literal: Two. Song Dao Gong first year.
cells.idiomatic: Two. This was the first year of Duke Dao of Song's reign.

cells.content: 七。烈侯好音，欲賜歌者田，徐越侍以仁義，乃止。
cells.literal: Seven. Marquis Lie loved music, wished to grant fields to singers, Xu Yue advised with benevolence and righteousness, thereupon stopped.
cells.idiomatic: Seven. Marquis Lie loved music and wished to grant fields to the singers. Xu Yue advised him with principles of benevolence and righteousness, and he desisted.
This was the first year of Duke Xi of Yan's reign.
This was the first year of King An's reign.
Fourteen. He attacked Wei and reached Yanghu.

cells.literal: Twenty-four. Qin attacked us, reached Yanghu.
cells.idiomatic: Twenty-four. Qin attacked us and reached Yanghu.

cells.literal: Chu Dao Wang Lei first year.
cells.idiomatic: This was the first year of King Dao of Chu's reign.
Twenty-five. Crown Prince Ying was born.

cells.literal: Two. Three Jins came attacked us, reached Chengqiu.
cells.idiomatic: Two. The Three Jins came to attack us and reached Chengqiu.

cells.literal: Three. Prince Zi Ding fled to Jin.
cells.idiomatic: Three. Prince Zi Ding fled to Jin.
This was the first year of Duke Hui of Qin's reign.

cells.literal: Twenty-six. Mount Guo collapsed, blocked river.
cells.idiomatic: Twenty-six. Mount Guo collapsed and blocked the Yellow River.
This was the first year of Marquis Lie of Han's reign.
This was the first year of Duke Wu of Zhao's reign.
Three. He returned Yuguan to Zheng.

cells.literal: Two. Zheng killed their chancellor Si Ziyang.
cells.idiomatic: Two. Zheng executed their chancellor Si Ziyang.

cells.content: 四。敗鄭師，圍鄭。鄭人殺子陽。
cells.literal: Four. Defeated Zheng army, besieged Zheng. Zheng people killed Ziyang.
cells.idiomatic: Four. He defeated the Zheng army and besieged Zheng. The people of Zheng killed Ziyang.
Three. There was a solar eclipse.

cells.content: 三。（鄭人殺君）三月，盜殺韓相俠累。
cells.literal: Three. (Zheng people killed their ruler) Third month, bandits killed Han chancellor Xia Lei.
cells.idiomatic: Three. In the third month, bandits assassinated Han's chancellor Xia Lei.

cells.content: 四。鄭相子陽之徒殺其君繻公。
cells.literal: Four. Zheng chancellor Ziyang's followers killed their ruler Xu Gong.
cells.idiomatic: Four. Followers of Zheng's chancellor Ziyang assassinated their ruler Duke Xu.

cells.literal: Five. Zheng Kang Gong first year.
cells.idiomatic: Five. This was the first year of Duke Kang of Zheng's reign.

cells.literal: Ten. Song Xiu Gong first year.
cells.idiomatic: Ten. This was the first year of Duke Xiu of Song's reign.

cells.literal: Six. Saved Lu. Zheng Fushu rebelled.
cells.idiomatic: Six. He rescued Lu. Fushu of Zheng rebelled.
Eleven. He attacked Lu and captured Zui.
Thirty-two. He attacked Zheng and walled Suanzhao.
Nine. He attacked Han and captured Fushu.

cells.literal: Thirty-three. Jin Xiao Gong Qing first year.
cells.idiomatic: Thirty-three. This was the first year of Duke Xiao of Jin's reign.

cells.literal: Nine. Attacked Han at Yiyang, captured six towns.
cells.idiomatic: Nine. He attacked Han at Yiyang and captured six towns.

cells.literal: Nine. Qin attacked Yiyang, captured six towns.
cells.idiomatic: Nine. Qin attacked Yiyang and captured six towns.

cells.literal: Ten. Fought with Jin at Wucheng. Established county at Shan.
cells.idiomatic: Ten. He fought with Jin at Wucheng. He established a county at Shan.
Thirty-five. Qi attacked and captured Xiangling.

cells.literal: Fifteen. Lu defeated us at Pinglu.
cells.idiomatic: Fifteen. Lu defeated us at Pinglu.
Eleven. The crown prince was born.

cells.literal: Sixteen. Met with Jin, Wei at Zhuze.
cells.idiomatic: Sixteen. He met with Jin and Wei at Zhuze.
This was the first year of Duke Chu of Qin's reign.

cells.content: 魏武侯。。元年。襲邯鄲，敗焉。
cells.literal: Wei Wu Hou first year. Attacked Handan, defeated there.
cells.idiomatic: This was the first year of Marquis Wu of Wei's reign. He attacked Handan but was defeated.
This was the first year of Marquis Wen of Han's reign.

cells.content: 趙敬侯元年。武公子朝作亂，奔魏。
cells.literal: Zhao Jing Hou first year. Wu's son Zhao made rebellion, fled to Wei.
cells.idiomatic: This was the first year of Marquis Jing of Zhao's reign. Prince Zhao, son of Wu, rebelled and fled to Wei.

cells.content: 十九。田常曾孫田和始列為諸侯。遷康公海上，食一城。
cells.literal: Nineteen. Tian Chang's great-grandson Tian He first ranked as lord. Moved Kang Gong to seaside, gave him one city.
cells.idiomatic: Nineteen. Tian He, great-grandson of Tian Chang, first ranked as a feudal lord. He moved Duke Kang to the seaside and gave him one city.

cells.content: 二。庶長改迎靈公太子，立為獻公。誅出公。
cells.literal: Two. Chamberlain Chang went welcomed Duke Ling's crown prince, established as Duke Xian. Executed Duke Chu.
cells.idiomatic: Two. Chamberlain Chang went to welcome the crown prince of Duke Ling and established him as Duke Xian. Duke Chu was executed.
Two. He walled Anyi and Wangyuan.

cells.content: 二。伐鄭，取陽城。伐宋，到彭城，執宋君。
cells.literal: Two. Attacked Zheng, captured Yangcheng. Attacked Song, reached Pengcheng, captured Song ruler.
cells.idiomatic: Two. He attacked Zheng and captured Yangcheng. He attacked Song, reached Pengcheng, and captured the ruler of Song.

cells.literal: Twenty. Attacked Lu, defeated it. Tian He died.
cells.idiomatic: Twenty. He attacked Lu and defeated it. Tian He died.
This was the first year of Duke Xian of Qin's reign.

cells.content: 二十一。田和子桓公午立。
cells.literal: Twenty-one. Tian He's son Duke Huan Wu stood.
cells.idiomatic: Twenty-one. Tian He's son, Duke Huan Wu, ascended the throne.

cells.literal: Four. Wei defeated us at Tutai.
cells.idiomatic: Four. Wei defeated us at Tutai.
Three. There was a solar eclipse; daytime turned dark.
Seven. He attacked Qi and reached Sangqiu.

cells.literal: Seven. Attacked Qi, reached Sangqiu. Zheng defeated Jin.
cells.idiomatic: Seven. He attacked Qi and reached Sangqiu. Zheng defeated Jin.
Seven. He attacked Qi and reached Sangqiu.

cells.literal: Chu Su Wang Zang first year.
cells.idiomatic: This was the first year of King Su of Chu's reign.
Twenty-five. He attacked Yan and captured Sangqiu.

cells.literal: Six. First established counties Pu, Lantian, Shanming clan.
cells.idiomatic: Six. He first established the counties of Pu, Lantian, and the Shanming clan.

cells.literal: Eight. Attacked Wei by surprise, did not succeed.
cells.idiomatic: Eight. He launched a surprise attack on Wei but did not succeed.

cells.content: 二十六。康公卒，田氏遂并齊而有之。太公望之後絕祀。
cells.literal: Twenty-six. Kang Gong died, Tian clan then annexed Qi and possessed it. The descendants of Duke Tai Gong Wang had their sacrifices cut off.
cells.idiomatic: Twenty-six. Duke Kang died, whereupon the Tian clan annexed Qi and took possession of it. The sacrificial rites of the descendants of Duke Tai Gong Wang were cut off.

cells.content: 九。翟敗我澮。伐齊，至靈丘。
cells.literal: Nine. Di defeated us at Kuai. Attacked Qi, reached Lingqiu.
cells.idiomatic: Nine. The Di defeated us at Kuai. He attacked Qi and reached Lingqiu.
Nine. He attacked Qi and reached Lingqiu.
Nine. He attacked Qi and reached Lingqiu.

cells.content: 齊威王因元年。自田常至威王，威王始以齊彊天下。
cells.literal: Qi Wei Wang Yin first year. From Tian Chang to King Wei, King Wei began making Qi strong throughout the world.
cells.idiomatic: This was the first year of King Wei of Qi's reign. From Tian Chang down to King Wei, King Wei was the first to make Qi strong throughout the world.

cells.literal: Ten. Jin Jing Gong Ju Jiu first year.
cells.idiomatic: Ten. This was the first year of Duke Jing of Jin's reign.

cells.content: 十一。魏、韓、趙滅晉，絕無後。
cells.literal: Eleven. Wei, Han, Zhao extinguished Jin, cut off without descendants.
cells.idiomatic: Eleven. Wei, Han, and Zhao extinguished Jin, leaving it without descendants.

cells.literal: Han Ai Hou first year. Divided the state of Jin.
cells.idiomatic: This was the first year of Marquis Ai of Han's reign. He divided the state of Jin.

cells.literal: Eleven. Divided the state of Jin.
cells.idiomatic: Eleven. He divided the state of Jin.

cells.literal: Five. Lu Gong Gong first year.
cells.idiomatic: Five. This was the first year of Duke Gong of Lu's reign.

cells.literal: Three. Three Jins extinguished their ruler.
cells.idiomatic: Three. The Three Jins extinguished their ruler.
This was the first year of King Lie's reign.
Ten. There was a solar eclipse.

cells.content: 二。滅鄭。康公二十年滅，無後。
cells.literal: Two. Extinguished Zheng. Duke Kang extinguished in twentieth year, without descendants.
cells.idiomatic: Two. He extinguished Zheng. Duke Kang was extinguished in his twentieth year, leaving no descendants.
Eleven. He established a county at Liuyang.
This was the first year of Marquis Cheng of Zhao's reign.
Thirty. He defeated Qi at Linggu.

cells.content: 六。魯伐入陽關。晉伐到鱄陵。
cells.literal: Six. Lu attacked entered Yangguan. Jin attacked reached Tingling.
cells.idiomatic: Six. Lu attacked and entered Yangguan. Jin attacked and reached Tingling.

cells.content: 十五。衛聲公元年。敗趙北藺。
cells.literal: Fifteen. Wei Sheng Gong first year. Defeated Zhao at Beilin.
cells.idiomatic: Fifteen. This was the first year of Duke Sheng of Wei's reign. He defeated Zhao at Beilin.

cells.content: 三。伐衛，取都鄙七十三。魏敗我藺。
cells.literal: Three. Attacked Wei, captured walled towns seventy-three. Wei defeated us at Lin.
cells.idiomatic: Three. He attacked Wei and captured seventy-three walled towns. Wei defeated us at the town of Lin.
This was the first year of Duke Huan of Yan's reign.

cells.literal: Seven. Song Pi Gong first year.
cells.idiomatic: Seven. This was the first year of Duke Pi of Song's reign.
Sixteen. He attacked Chu and captured Luyang.

cells.literal: Six. Han Yan killed his ruler.
cells.idiomatic: Six. Han Yan assassinated his ruler.
This was the first year of King Hui's reign.
This was the first year of Marquis Zhuang's reign.

cells.literal: Five. Attacked Qi at Zhen. Wei defeated us at Huai.
cells.idiomatic: Five. He attacked Qi at Zhen. Wei defeated us at Huai.

cells.literal: Sixteen. People suffered great epidemic. Solar eclipse.
cells.idiomatic: Sixteen. The people suffered from a great epidemic. There was a solar eclipse.
Two. He defeated Han at Maling.

cells.literal: Two. Wei defeated us at Maling.
cells.idiomatic: Two. Wei defeated us at Maling.

cells.literal: Six. Defeated Wei at Zhuozhe, surrounded Hui Wang.
cells.idiomatic: Six. He defeated Wei at Zhuozhe and surrounded King Hui.

cells.literal: Chu Xuan Wang Liangfu first year.
cells.idiomatic: This was the first year of King Xuan of Chu's reign.
Ten. This was the first year of Duke Ticheng of Song's reign.
This was the first year of King Xian's reign.

cells.content: 十七。櫟陽雨金，四月至八月。
cells.literal: Seventeen. Liuyang rained gold, from fourth month to eighth month.
cells.idiomatic: Seventeen. Gold rained in Liuyang from the fourth month through the eighth month.

cells.literal: Seven. Invaded Qi, reached the Great Wall.
cells.idiomatic: Seven. He invaded Qi and reached the Great Wall.

cells.content: 十一。伐魏取觀。趙侵我長城。
cells.literal: Eleven. Attacked Wei captured Guan. Zhao invaded our Great Wall.
cells.idiomatic: Eleven. He attacked Wei and captured Guan. Zhao invaded our Great Wall.

cells.literal: Nineteen. Defeated Han, Wei at Luoyin.
cells.idiomatic: Nineteen. He defeated Han and Wei at Luoyin.

cells.literal: Five. Met with Han at Zhaiyang. Walled Wudu.
cells.idiomatic: Five. He met with Han at Zhaiyang. He walled Wudu.
Six. He attacked Song and captured Yitai.

cells.content: 二十一。章蟜與晉戰石門，。。斬首六萬，天子賀。
cells.literal: Twenty-one. Zhang Zhang fought with Jin at Shimen, .. Beheaded sixty thousand, the Son of Heaven congratulated.
cells.idiomatic: Twenty-one. Zhang Zhang fought with Jin at Shimen and beheaded sixty thousand, whereupon the Son of Heaven congratulated him.

cells.content: 二十三。與魏戰少梁，虜其太子。
cells.literal: Twenty-three. Fought with Wei at Shaoliang, captured their crown prince.
cells.idiomatic: Twenty-three. He fought with Wei at Shaoliang and captured their crown prince.

cells.content: 九。與秦戰少梁，虜我太子。
cells.literal: Nine. Fought with Qin at Shaoliang, captured our crown prince.
cells.idiomatic: Nine. He fought with Qin at Shaoliang and captured our crown prince.

cells.content: 九。魏敗我于澮。大雨三月。
cells.literal: Nine. Wei defeated us at Kuai. Great rain for three months.
cells.idiomatic: Nine. Wei defeated us at Kuai. There was great rain for three months.

cells.literal: Thirteen. Wei defeated us at Kuai.
cells.idiomatic: Thirteen. Wei defeated us at Kuai.

cells.content: 秦孝公元年。彗星見西方。
cells.literal: Qin Xiao Gong first year. Comet appeared in the west.
cells.idiomatic: This was the first year of Duke Xiao of Qin's reign. A comet appeared in the west.

cells.content: 十。取趙皮牢。衛成侯元年。
cells.literal: Ten. Took Zhao's Pi Lao. Wei Cheng Hou first year.
cells.idiomatic: Ten. He took Pi Lao from Zhao. This was the first year of Marquis Cheng of Wei's reign.
This was the first year of Duke Wen of Yan's reign.
Nine. He presented sacrifices to Qin.

cells.literal: Two. The Son of Heaven presented sacrifices.
cells.idiomatic: Two. The Son of Heaven presented sacrifices.

cells.literal: Twelve. Stars fell in daylight, with sound.
cells.idiomatic: Twelve. Stars fell in daylight with a sound.

cells.content: 韓昭侯元年。秦敗我西山。
cells.literal: Han Zhao Hou first year. Qin defeated us at Xishan.
cells.idiomatic: This was the first year of Marquis Zhao of Han's reign. Qin defeated us at Xishan.

cells.content: 二十一。鄒忌以鼓琴見威王。
cells.literal: Twenty-one. Zou Ji presented himself to King Wei by playing the zither.
cells.idiomatic: Twenty-one. Zou Ji presented himself to King Wei by playing the zither.

cells.literal: Fourteen. Met with Zhao at Huo.
cells.idiomatic: Fourteen. He met with Zhao at Huo.

cells.content: 二。宋取我黃池。魏取我朱。
cells.literal: Two. Song took our Huangchi. Wei took our Zhu.
cells.idiomatic: Two. Song took our Huangchi. Wei took our Zhu.

cells.literal: Eighteen. Zhao Meng went to Qi.
cells.idiomatic: Eighteen. Zhao Meng went to Qi.

cells.literal: Thirteen. Jun Yin Hei went to welcome a bride from Qin.
cells.idiomatic: Thirteen. Jun Yin Hei went to welcome a bride from Qin.

cells.literal: Twenty-two. Enfeoffed Zou Ji as Marquis Cheng.
cells.idiomatic: Twenty-two. He enfeoffed Zou Ji as Marquis Cheng.

cells.literal: Fifteen. The marquises of Lu, Wei, Song, and Zheng came.
cells.idiomatic: Fifteen. The marquises of Lu, Wei, Song, and Zheng came.

cells.content: 十九。與燕會阿。與齊、宋會平陸。
cells.literal: Nineteen. Met with Yan at E. Met with Qi and Song at Pinglu.
cells.idiomatic: Nineteen. He met with Yan at the E and with Qi and Song at the Pinglu.

cells.literal: Twenty-three. Met with Zhao at Pinglu.
cells.idiomatic: Twenty-three. He met with Zhao at Pinglu.

cells.literal: Seven. Met with the King of Wei at Duping.
cells.idiomatic: Seven. He met with the King of Wei at Duping.

cells.content: 十六。與秦孝公會杜平。侵宋黃池，宋復取之。
cells.literal: Sixteen. Met with Duke Xiao of Qin at Duping. Invaded Song's Huangchi, Song recaptured it.
cells.idiomatic: Sixteen. He met with Duke Xiao of Qin at the Duping. He invaded Song's Huangchi, but Song recaptured it.

cells.literal: Twenty-four. Met with Wei for a hunt in the suburbs.
cells.idiomatic: Twenty-four. He met with Wei for a hunt in the suburbs.

cells.content: 八。與魏戰元里，斬首七千，取少梁。
cells.literal: Eight. Fought with Wei at Yuanli, beheaded seven thousand, took Shaoliang.
cells.idiomatic: Eight. He fought with Wei at the Yuanli, beheaded seven thousand, and took the Shaoliang.

cells.content: 十七。與秦戰元里，秦取我少梁。
cells.literal: Seventeen. Fought with Qin at Yuanli, Qin took our Shaoliang.
cells.idiomatic: Seventeen. He fought with Qin at Yuanli, and Qin took our Shaoliang.

cells.content: 十八。邯鄲降。齊敗我桂陵。
cells.literal: Eighteen. Handan surrendered. Qi defeated us at Guiling.
cells.idiomatic: Eighteen. Handan surrendered. Qi defeated us at Guiling.

cells.literal: Six. Attacked Eastern Zhou, took Lingguan and Linqiu.
cells.idiomatic: Six. He attacked Eastern Zhou and took Lingguan and Linqiu.
Twenty-six. He defeated Wei at Guiling.

cells.content: 十。衛公孫鞅為大良造，伐安邑，降之。
cells.literal: Ten. Wei Gongsun Yang became Grand Steward, attacked Anyi, caused it to surrender.
cells.idiomatic: Ten. Wei Gongsun Yang became the Grand Steward, attacked Anyi, and caused it to surrender.

cells.content: 十九。諸侯圍我襄陵。築長城，塞固陽。
cells.literal: Nineteen. The lords besieged our Xiangling. Built the Great Wall, blocked Guyang.
cells.idiomatic: Nineteen. The lords besieged our Xiangling. They built the Great Wall and blocked Guyang.

cells.literal: Eighteen. Lu Kang Gong first year.
cells.idiomatic: Eighteen. This was the first year of Duke Kang of Lu's reign.

cells.content: 十一。城商塞。衛鞅圍固陽，降之。
cells.literal: Eleven. Walled Shangse. Wei Yang besieged Guyang, caused it to surrender.
cells.idiomatic: Eleven. He walled the Shangse. Wei Yang besieged the Guyang and caused it to surrender.
Twenty. He returned Handan to Zhao.

cells.content: 二十四。魏歸邯鄲，與魏盟漳水上。
cells.literal: Twenty-four. Wei returned Handan, made alliance with Wei on the Zhang River.
cells.idiomatic: Twenty-four. Wei returned Handan and made an alliance with Wei on the Zhang River.

cells.content: 十二。初聚小邑為三十一縣，令。為田開阡陌。
cells.literal: Twelfth year. Initially gathered small towns into thirty-one counties, commanderies. For the fields opened the paths and boundaries.
cells.idiomatic: Twelfth year. Small towns were initially gathered into thirty-one counties and commanderies. The fields were opened with paths and boundaries established.

cells.literal: Twenty-first year. With Qin encountered at Tong.
cells.idiomatic: Twenty-first year. Qin forces were encountered at Tong.

cells.literal: Thirteenth year. Initially established scribes, salaried scribes.
cells.idiomatic: Thirteenth year. Scribes were initially established, including salaried scribes.

cells.literal: Tenth year. Han Ji assassinated her lord Duke Dao.
cells.idiomatic: Tenth year. Lady Han assassinated her lord, Duke Dao.
First year of Marquis Su of Zhao.
Fourteenth year. Taxes were initially established.

cells.literal: Eleventh year. Marquis Zhao went to Qin.
cells.idiomatic: Eleventh year. Marquis Zhao traveled to Qin.

cells.content: 三。公子范襲邯鄲，不勝，死。
cells.literal: Third year. Prince Fan attacked Handan, was not victorious, died.
cells.idiomatic: Third year. Prince Fan attacked Handan but was unsuccessful and died.

cells.literal: Thirty-third year. Killed his official Mu Xin.
cells.idiomatic: Thirty-third year. The ruler killed his official, Mu Xin.

cells.literal: Twenty-fifth year. The feudal lords assembled.
cells.idiomatic: Twenty-fifth year. The feudal lords held an assembly.

cells.content: 二十七。丹封名會。丹，魏大臣。
cells.literal: Twenty-seventh year. Dan, Feng, Ming assembled. Dan was a Wei minister.
cells.idiomatic: Twenty-seventh year. Dan, Feng, and Ming assembled. Dan was a minister of Wei.

cells.literal: Thirty-fifth year. Tian Ji attacked Qi, was not victorious.
cells.idiomatic: Thirty-fifth year. Tian Ji attacked Qi but was unsuccessful.

cells.literal: Twenty-sixth year. Presented the elder to Qin.
cells.idiomatic: Twenty-sixth year. Presented the elder to Qin.

cells.content: 十九。城武城。從東方牡丘來歸。天子致伯。
cells.literal: Nineteenth year. Walled Wucheng. From Dongfang Muqiu came to submit. The Son of Heaven presented the elder.
cells.idiomatic: Nineteenth year. Wucheng was walled. People from Dongfang Muqiu came to submit. The Son of Heaven presented the elder.

cells.literal: Twenty-seventh year. Duke Jing of Lu Yan, first year.
cells.idiomatic: Twenty-seventh year. First year of Duke Jing of Lu, Yan.

cells.content: 二十。諸侯畢賀。會諸侯于澤。朝天子。
cells.literal: Twentieth year. All the feudal lords congratulated. Assembled the feudal lords at Ze. Audience with the Son of Heaven.
cells.idiomatic: Twentieth year. All the feudal lords offered congratulations. The feudal lords were assembled at Ze. Audience with the Son of Heaven.

cells.literal: Twenty-ninth year. Lord of Zhongshan became chancellor.
cells.idiomatic: Twenty-ninth year. The Lord of Zhongshan became chancellor.

cells.literal: King Xuan of Qi Bi Qiang, first year.
cells.idiomatic: First year of King Xuan of Qi, Bi Qiang.

cells.literal: Twenty-first year. Horses gave birth to humans.
cells.idiomatic: Twenty-first year. Horses gave birth to humans.

cells.content: 三十。齊虜我太子申，殺將軍龐涓。
cells.literal: Thirtieth year. Qi captured our Crown Prince Shen, killed General Pang Juan.
cells.idiomatic: Thirtieth year. The state of Qi captured our Crown Prince Shen and killed General Pang Juan.

cells.content: 二。敗魏馬陵。田忌、田嬰、田馊將，孫子為師。
cells.literal: Second year. Defeated Wei at Ma Ling. Tian Ji, Tian Ying, Tian Chou were generals, Sun Zi was the master.
cells.idiomatic: Second year. Wei was defeated at Ma Ling. Tian Ji, Tian Ying, and Tian Chou were generals, with Sun Zi as the master.

cells.literal: Twenty-second year. Enfeoffed Grand Steward Shang Yang.
cells.idiomatic: Twenty-second year. The Grand Steward Shang Yang was enfeoffed.

cells.content: 三十一。秦商君伐我，虜我公子卬。
cells.literal: Thirty-first year. Qin's Lord Shang attacked us, captured our Prince Ang.
cells.idiomatic: Thirty-first year. The Lord Shang of Qin attacked us and captured our Prince Ang.

cells.literal: Third year. With Zhao assembled, attacked Wei.
cells.idiomatic: Third year. Met with Zhao and attacked Wei.

cells.literal: Twenty-third year. With Jin fought at An Men.
cells.idiomatic: Twenty-third year. Fought with Jin at An Men.

cells.literal: Thirty-second year. Prince He became crown prince.
cells.idiomatic: Thirty-second year. Prince He became the crown prince.

cells.literal: King Wei of Chu Xiong Shang, first year.
cells.idiomatic: First year of King Wei of Chu, Xiong Shang.

cells.content: 二十四。（秦）大荔圍合陽。孝公薨。商君反，死彤地。
cells.literal: Twenty-fourth year. (Qin) Dali besieged Heyang. Duke Xiao died. Lord Shang rebelled, died at Tong land.
cells.idiomatic: Twenty-fourth year. Qin forces at Dali besieged Heyang. Duke Xiao died. The Lord Shang rebelled and died at Tong.

cells.content: 三十三。衛鞅亡歸我，我恐，弗內。
cells.literal: Thirty-third year. Wei Yang fled and returned to us, we were afraid, did not let him in.
cells.idiomatic: Thirty-third year. The Wei Yang fled and sought refuge with us, but we were afraid and refused to admit him.

cells.content: 秦惠文王元年。楚、韓、趙、蜀人來。
cells.literal: King Huiwen of Qin, first year. Chu, Han, Zhao, Shu people came.
cells.idiomatic: First year of King Huiwen of Qin. The envoys from Chu, Han, Zhao, and Shu arrived.

cells.content: 二。天子賀。行錢。宋太丘社亡。
cells.literal: Second year. The Son of Heaven congratulated. Circulated money. Song's Taiqiu altar disappeared.
cells.idiomatic: Second year. The Son of Heaven offered congratulations. Money was circulated. Song's Taiqiu altar vanished.

cells.content: 三十五。孟子來，王問利國，對曰：「君不可言利。」
cells.literal: Thirty-fifth year. Mencius came, the king asked about benefiting the state, he replied: 'The ruler may not speak of profit.'
cells.idiomatic: Thirty-fifth year. Mencius arrived and the king asked him about benefiting the state. He replied: 'The ruler may not speak of profit.'

cells.literal: Seventh year. With Wei assembled at Ping'e Nan.
cells.idiomatic: Seventh year. Met with Wei at Ping'e Nan.

cells.literal: Third year. The king was crowned. Took Han's Yiyang.
cells.idiomatic: Third year. The king was crowned. Yiyang was taken from Han.

cells.literal: Twenty-fourth year. Qin took our Yiyang.
cells.idiomatic: Twenty-fourth year. Qin captured our Yiyang.

cells.literal: Eighth year. With Wei assembled at Zhen.
cells.idiomatic: Eighth year. Met with Wei at Zhen.

cells.content: 四。天子致文武胙。魏夫人來。
cells.literal: Fourth year. The Son of Heaven presented the sacrificial meat of Wen and Wu. The Wei lady came.
cells.idiomatic: Fourth year. The Son of Heaven presented the sacrificial offerings of Wen and Wu. The lady from Wei arrived.

cells.content: 魏襄王元年。與諸侯會徐州，以相王。
cells.literal: King Xiang of Wei, first year. With the feudal lords assembled at Xuzhou, to crown each other as kings.
cells.idiomatic: First year of King Xiang of Wei. Met with the feudal lords at Xuzhou to crown each other as kings.

cells.content: 二十五。旱。作高門，屈宜臼曰「昭侯不出此門。」
cells.literal: Twenty-fifth year. Drought. Made the High Gate, Qu Yujiu said 'The Marquis Zhao will not emerge from this gate.'
cells.idiomatic: Twenty-fifth year. There was a drought. The High Gate was constructed, and Qu Yujiu said: 'Marquis Zhao will not leave through this gate.'

cells.literal: Twenty-eighth year. Su Qin persuaded Yan.
cells.idiomatic: Twenty-eighth year. Su Qin persuaded Yan.

cells.content: 九。與魏會徐州，諸侯相王。
cells.literal: Ninth year. With Wei assembled at Xuzhou, the feudal lords crowned each other as kings.
cells.idiomatic: Ninth year. Met with Wei at Xuzhou where the feudal lords crowned each other as kings.

cells.content: 五。陰晉人犀首為大良造。
cells.literal: Fifth year. Xi Shou from Yinjin became Grand Steward.
cells.idiomatic: Fifth year. Xi Shou of Yinjin became the Grand Steward.

cells.literal: Second year. Qin defeated us at Diaoyin.
cells.idiomatic: Second year. Qin defeated us at Diaoyin.

cells.content: 二十六。高門成，昭侯卒，不出此門。
cells.literal: Twenty-sixth year. The High Gate was completed, Marquis Zhao died, did not emerge from this gate.
cells.idiomatic: Twenty-sixth year. The High Gate was completed. Marquis Zhao died without ever leaving through it.

cells.literal: Seventh year. Besieged Qi at Xuzhou.
cells.idiomatic: Seventh year. Besieged Qi at Xuzhou.

cells.literal: Tenth year. Chu besieged our Xuzhou.
cells.idiomatic: Tenth year. Chu besieged our Xuzhou.

cells.content: 六。魏以陰晉為和，命曰寧秦。
cells.literal: Sixth year. Wei used Yinjin as peace terms, named it Ning Qin.
cells.idiomatic: Sixth year. Wei ceded Yinjin as peace terms and renamed it Ning Qin.

cells.literal: Third year. Attacked Zhao. Wei Ping Hou, first year.
cells.idiomatic: Third year. Attacked Zhao. First year of Marquis Ping of Wei.

cells.literal: Han Xuan Hui Wang, first year.
cells.idiomatic: First year of King Xuan Hui of Han.

cells.content: 十八。齊、魏伐我，我決河水浸之。
cells.literal: Eighteenth year. Qi, Wei attacked us, we breached the river water to flood them.
cells.idiomatic: Eighteenth year. Qi and Wei attacked us, so we breached the river dikes to flood them.
First year of King Yi of Yan.

cells.literal: Eleventh year. With Wei attacked Zhao.
cells.idiomatic: Eleventh year. Joined with Wei to attack Zhao.

cells.content: 七。義渠內亂，庶長操將兵定之。
cells.literal: Seventh year. Yiqu had internal disorder, Chamberlain Cao led troops to pacify it.
cells.idiomatic: Seventh year. Yiqu suffered internal disorder, so Chamberlain Cao led troops to pacify it.

cells.literal: Eighth year. Wei ceded Hexi lands to Qin.
cells.idiomatic: Eighth year. Wei ceded the lands west of the river to Qin.

cells.content: 五。與秦河西地少梁。秦圍我焦、曲沃。
cells.literal: Fifth year. Exchanged Shaoliang in Hexi lands with Qin. Qin besieged our Jiao, Quwo.
cells.idiomatic: Fifth year. Exchanged Shaoliang in the lands west of the river with Qin. Qin besieged our Jiao and Quwo.

cells.content: 九。度河，取汾陰、皮氏。圍焦，降之。與魏會應。
cells.literal: Ninth year. Crossed the river, took Fenying, Pishi. Besieged Jiao, caused it to surrender. With Wei assembled at Ying.
cells.idiomatic: Ninth year. Crossed the river and captured Fenying and Pishi. Besieged Jiao and forced its surrender. Met with Wei at Ying.

cells.content: 六。與秦會應。秦取汾陰、皮氏。
cells.literal: Sixth year. With Qin assembled at Ying. Qin took Fenying, Pishi.
cells.idiomatic: Sixth year. Met with Qin at Ying. Qin captured Fenying and Pishi.

cells.literal: Eleventh year. Wei defeated us at Xing Mountain.
cells.idiomatic: Eleventh year. Wei defeated us at Mount Xing.

cells.content: 十。張儀相。公子桑圍蒲陽，降之。魏納上郡。
cells.literal: Tenth year. Zhang Yi became chancellor. Prince Sang besieged Puyang, caused it to surrender. Wei ceded Shangjun.
cells.idiomatic: Tenth year. The Zhang Yi became chancellor. Prince Sang besieged Puyang and forced its surrender. Wei ceded Shangjun.

cells.literal: Seventh year. Ceded Shangjun to Qin.
cells.idiomatic: Seventh year. Shangjun was ceded to Qin.

cells.literal: King Huai of Chu Huai, first year.
cells.idiomatic: First year of King Huai of Chu, Huai.

cells.literal: Fifteenth year. Lord Yan of Song, first year.
cells.idiomatic: Fifteenth year. First year of Lord Yan of Song.

cells.content: 十一。義渠君為臣。歸魏焦、曲沃。
cells.literal: Eleventh year. Yiqu Lord became minister. Returned Jiao, Quwo to Wei.
cells.idiomatic: Eleventh year. The Lord of Yiqu became a minister. Jiao and Quwo were returned to Wei.

cells.literal: Eighth year. Qin returned our Jiao, Quwo.
cells.idiomatic: Eighth year. Qin returned our Jiao and Quwo.

cells.literal: Twelfth year. Initially La sacrifice. Assembled at Longmen.
cells.idiomatic: Twelfth year. The La sacrifice was initially held. Met at Longmen.

cells.literal: Thirteenth year. Fourth month Wuwu day, ruler became king.
cells.idiomatic: Thirteenth year. On the wuwu day of the fourth month, the ruler became king.

cells.literal: Eighth year. Wei defeated our Han Ju.
cells.idiomatic: Eighth year. Wei defeated our Han Ju.

cells.content: 趙武靈王元年。魏敗我趙護。
cells.literal: Zhao Wuling Wang, first year. Wei defeated our Zhao Hu.
cells.idiomatic: First year of King Wuling of Zhao. Wei defeated our Zhao Hu.

cells.content: 相張儀將兵取陝。初更元年
cells.literal: Chancellor Zhang Yi led troops to take Shan. Initially changed to first year.
cells.idiomatic: Chancellor Zhang Yi led troops to capture Shan. Initially changed the calendar to first year.

cells.literal: Eleventh year. Wei Si Jun, first year.
cells.idiomatic: Eleventh year. First year of Lord Si of Wei.

cells.content: 二。相張儀與齊、楚會齧桑。
cells.literal: Second year. Chancellor Zhang Yi with Qi, Chu assembled at Nie Sang.
cells.idiomatic: Second year. Chancellor Zhang Yi met with Qi and Chu at Nie Sang.
Tenth year. The ruler became king.

cells.literal: Sixth year. Defeated Wei at Xiangling.
cells.idiomatic: Sixth year. Wei was defeated at Xiangling.
Tenth year. The ruler became king.

cells.literal: King Min of Qi Di, first year.
cells.idiomatic: First year of King Min of Qi, Di.

cells.literal: Third year. Zhang Yi was dismissed as chancellor, became chancellor of Wei.
cells.idiomatic: Third year. Zhang Yi was dismissed as chancellor and became chancellor of Wei.

cells.content: 十三。秦取曲沃。平周女化為丈夫。
cells.literal: Thirteenth year. Qin took Quwo. Ping Zhou's daughter transformed into a man.
cells.idiomatic: Thirteenth year. Qin captured Quwo. Ping Zhou's daughter transformed into a man.

cells.literal: Fourth year. With Han assembled at Qu Shu.
cells.idiomatic: Fourth year. Met with Han at Qu Shu.

cells.literal: Fifth year. Took Han woman as lady.
cells.idiomatic: Fifth year. Took a woman from Han as his lady.

cells.literal: Third year. Enfeoffed Tian Ying at Xue.
cells.idiomatic: Third year. Tian Ying was enfeoffed at Xue.
First year of King Shen Jing.

cells.literal: Fifth year. The king traveled north to Rong lands, reached the river.
cells.idiomatic: Fifth year. The king traveled north to Rong territories, reaching the river.

cells.literal: King Kui of Yan, first year.
cells.idiomatic: First year of King Kui of Yan.

cells.literal: Fourth year. Welcomed bride from Qin.
cells.idiomatic: Fourth year. A bride was welcomed from Qin.

cells.literal: Fourteenth year. Qin came to attack us, took Yan.
cells.idiomatic: Fourteenth year. Qin came to attack us and captured Yan.

cells.content: 七。五國共擊秦，不勝而還。
cells.literal: Seventh year. Five states jointly attacked Qin, did not win and returned.
cells.idiomatic: Seventh year. The five states jointly attacked Qin but failed to win and returned.

cells.literal: King Ai of Wei, first year. Attacked Qin but did not win.
cells.idiomatic: First year of King Ai of Wei. Attacked Qin but failed to win.

cells.literal: Fifteenth year. Attacked Qin but did not win.
cells.idiomatic: Fifteenth year. Attacked Qin but failed to win.

cells.literal: Eighth year. Attacked Qin but did not win.
cells.idiomatic: Eighth year. Attacked Qin but failed to win.

cells.literal: Eleventh year. Attacked Qin but did not win.
cells.idiomatic: Eleventh year. Attacked Qin but failed to win.

cells.literal: Third year. Attacked Qin but did not win.
cells.idiomatic: Third year. Attacked Qin but failed to win.

cells.literal: Sixth year. Song established himself as king.
cells.idiomatic: Sixth year. Song proclaimed himself king.

cells.content: 八。與韓、趙戰，斬首八萬。張儀復相。
cells.literal: Eighth year. Fought with Han, Zhao, beheaded eighty thousand. Zhang Yi became chancellor again.
cells.idiomatic: Eighth year. Fought with Han and Zhao, taking eighty thousand heads. The Zhang Yi became chancellor again.

cells.literal: Second year. Qi defeated us at Guanze.
cells.idiomatic: Second year. Qi defeated us at Guanze.

cells.content: 十六。秦敗我脩魚，得將軍申差。
cells.literal: Sixteenth year. Qin defeated us at Xiuyu, captured General Shen Chai.
cells.idiomatic: Sixteenth year. Qin defeated us at Xiuyu and captured General Shen Chai.

cells.content: 九。與韓、魏擊秦。齊敗我觀澤。
cells.literal: Ninth year. With Han, Wei attacked Qin. Qi defeated us at Guanze.
cells.idiomatic: Ninth year. Joined with Han and Wei to attack Qin. Qi defeated us at Guanze.

cells.literal: Seventh year. Defeated Wei, Zhao at Guanze.
cells.idiomatic: Seventh year. Defeated Wei and Zhao at Guanze.

cells.content: 九。擊蜀，滅之。取趙中都、西陽。
cells.literal: Ninth year. Attacked Shu, extinguished it. Took Zhao's Zhongdu, Xiyang.
cells.idiomatic: Ninth year. Attacked Shu and destroyed it. Captured the Zhao's Zhongdu and Xiyang.

cells.literal: Tenth year. Qin took our Zhongdu, Xiyang.
cells.idiomatic: Tenth year. Qin captured our Zhongdu and Xiyang.

cells.content: 五。君讓其臣子之國，顧為臣。
cells.literal: Fifth year. The ruler yielded his minister's son's state, then became minister.
cells.idiomatic: Fifth year. The ruler yielded his minister's son's state and then became a minister himself.

cells.literal: Eleventh year. Qin defeated our General Ying.
cells.idiomatic: Eleventh year. Qin defeated our General Ying.

cells.literal: King Nan of Zhou, first year.
cells.idiomatic: First year of King Nan of Zhou.

cells.content: 十一。侵義渠，得二十五城。
cells.literal: Eleventh year. Invaded Yiqu, obtained twenty-five cities.
cells.idiomatic: Eleventh year. Invaded Yiqu and captured twenty-five cities.

cells.content: 五。秦拔我曲沃，歸其人。走犀首岸門。
cells.literal: Fifth year. Qin took our Quwo, returned its people. Xi Shou fled to Anmen.
cells.idiomatic: Fifth year. Qin captured our Quwo but returned its people. The Xi Shou fled to Anmen.

cells.literal: Fifteenth year. Lu Ping Gong, first year.
cells.idiomatic: Fifteenth year. First year of Duke Ping of Lu.

cells.content: 七。君噲及太子相子之皆死。
cells.literal: Seventh year. Lord Kui and Crown Prince Xiang Zi all died.
cells.idiomatic: Seventh year. Lord Kui and Crown Prince Xiang Zi both died.

cells.content: 十二。樗里子擊藺陽，虜趙將。公子繇通封蜀。
cells.literal: Twelfth year. Chu Li Zi attacked Linyang, captured Zhao general. Prince You established Shu as fief.
cells.idiomatic: Twelfth year. Chu Li Zi attacked Linyang and captured a Zhao general. Prince You was granted Shu as his fief.

cells.content: 六。秦來立公子政為太子。與秦王會臨晉。
cells.literal: Sixth year. Qin came to establish Prince Zheng as crown prince. With Qin king assembled at Linjin.
cells.idiomatic: Sixth year. Qin came to establish Prince Zheng as crown prince. Met with the Qin king at Linjin.

cells.content: 十三。秦拔我藺，虜將趙莊。
cells.literal: Thirteenth year. Qin took our Lin, captured General Zhao Zhuang.
cells.idiomatic: Thirteenth year. Qin captured our Lin and took General Zhao Zhuang prisoner.

cells.literal: Sixteenth year. Zhang Yi came as chancellor.
cells.idiomatic: Sixteenth year. Zhang Yi arrived to serve as chancellor.

cells.content: 十三。庶長章擊楚，斬首八萬。
cells.literal: Thirteenth year. Chamberlain Zhang attacked Chu, beheaded eighty thousand.
cells.idiomatic: Thirteenth year. Chamberlain Zhang attacked Chu and took eighty thousand heads.

cells.content: 七。擊齊，虜聲子於濮。與秦擊燕。
cells.literal: Seventh year. Attacked Qi, captured Sheng Zi at Pu. With Qin attacked Yan.
cells.idiomatic: Seventh year. Attacked Qi and captured the Sheng Zi at Pu. Joined with Qin to attack Yan.

cells.content: 二十一。我秦攻楚，圍景座。
cells.literal: Twenty-first year. Our Qin attacked Chu, besieged Jing Zuo.
cells.idiomatic: Twenty-first year. Our Qin attacked Chu and besieged Jing Zuo.

cells.literal: Seventeenth year. Qin defeated our General Qu Tun.
cells.idiomatic: Seventeenth year. Qin defeated our General Qu Tun.

cells.literal: Ninth year. Yan people jointly established Prince Ping.
cells.idiomatic: Ninth year. The people of Yan jointly established Prince Ping as ruler.

cells.literal: Fourteenth year. Shu chancellor killed Shu Hou.
cells.idiomatic: Fourteenth year. The Shu chancellor assassinated the Lord of Shu.
First year of King Xiang of Han.
First year of King Zhao of Yan.

cells.content: 秦武王元年。誅蜀相壯。張儀、魏章皆出之魏。
cells.literal: Qin Wu Wang, first year. Executed Shu chancellor Zhuang. Zhang Yi, Wei Zhang both sent out to Wei.
cells.idiomatic: First year of King Wu of Qin. Executed the Shu chancellor Zhuang. Zhang Yi and Wei Zhang were both sent to Wei.

cells.literal: Ninth year. With Qin assembled at Linjin.
cells.idiomatic: Ninth year. Met with Qin at Linjin.

cells.content: 十六。吳廣入女，生子何，立為惠王后。
cells.literal: Sixteenth year. Wu Guang brought in woman, gave birth to son He, established as Queen Hui Wang.
cells.idiomatic: Sixteenth year. Wu Guang took a wife who bore him a son named He, who was established as Queen Hui Wang.

cells.content: 二。初置丞相，樗里子、甘茂為丞相。
cells.literal: Second year. Initially established chancellor position, Chu Li Zi, Gan Mao became chancellors.
cells.idiomatic: Second year. The chancellor position was established for the first time, with Chu Li Zi and Gan Mao serving as chancellors.

cells.literal: Eleventh year. With Qin assembled at Ying.
cells.idiomatic: Eleventh year. Met with Qin at Ying.

cells.content: 四。與秦會臨晉。秦擊我宜陽。
cells.literal: Fourth year. With Qin assembled at Linjin. Qin attacked our Yiyang.
cells.idiomatic: Fourth year. Met with Qin at Linjin. Qin attacked our Yiyang.

cells.content: 四。拔宜陽城，斬首六萬。涉河，城武遂。
cells.literal: Fourth year. Captured the city of Yiyang, beheaded sixty thousand. Crossed the Yellow River, walled Wushui.
cells.idiomatic: Fourth year. They captured the city of Yiyang and beheaded sixty thousand men. They crossed the Yellow River and built walls around Wushui.

cells.literal: Twelfth year. The crown prince went to pay court to Qin.
cells.idiomatic: Twelfth year. The crown prince traveled to Qin to pay his respects at court.

cells.content: 五。秦拔我宜陽，斬首六萬。
cells.literal: Fifth year. Qin captured our Yiyang, beheaded sixty thousand.
cells.idiomatic: Fifth year. Qin captured our city of Yiyang and beheaded sixty thousand of our soldiers.

cells.literal: Nineteenth year. First adopted barbarian clothing.
cells.idiomatic: Nineteenth year. For the first time, they adopted the clothing style of the northern barbarians.

cells.literal: First year of King Zhaoxiang of Qin's reign
cells.idiomatic: This was the first year of King Zhaoxiang of Qin's reign.

cells.content: 十三。秦擊皮氏，未拔而解。
cells.literal: Thirteenth year. Qin attacked Pishi, but failed to capture it and withdrew.
cells.idiomatic: Thirteenth year. Qin attacked the city of Pishi, but when they failed to capture it, they withdrew their forces.

cells.literal: Sixth year. Qin returned Wushui to us.
cells.idiomatic: Sixth year. Qin returned the territory of Wushui to us.

cells.literal: Second year. Comet appeared. Sang Jun rebelled, executed.
cells.idiomatic: Second year. A comet appeared in the sky. Sang Jun launched a rebellion and was executed.

cells.literal: Fourteenth year. Qin King Wu's queen returned.
cells.idiomatic: Fourteenth year. The queen of King Wu of Qin returned home.

cells.literal: Twenty-fourth year. Qin came to welcome the bride.
cells.idiomatic: Twenty-fourth year. Qin sent envoys to welcome the bride.

cells.content: 二十五。與秦王會黃觉，秦復歸我上庸。
cells.literal: Twenty-fifth year. Met with the king of Qin at Huangjue, Qin returned Shangyong to us.
cells.idiomatic: Twenty-fifth year. We met with the king of Qin at Huangjue, and Qin returned the territory of Shangyong to us.
Fourth year. A comet appeared in the sky.

cells.content: 十六。秦拔我蒲阪、晉陽、封陵。
cells.literal: Sixteenth year. Qin captured our Puban, Jinyang, Fengling.
cells.idiomatic: Sixteenth year. Qin captured our cities of Puban, Jinyang, and Fengling.
Ninth year. Qin captured the territory of Wushui.

cells.literal: Twenty-sixth year. The crown prince was held hostage in Qin.
cells.idiomatic: Twenty-sixth year. The crown prince was sent as a hostage to Qin.

cells.literal: Fifth year. Wei king came to pay court.
cells.idiomatic: Fifth year. The king of Wei came to pay his respects at court.

cells.content: 十七。與秦會臨晉，復歸我蒲阪。
cells.literal: Seventeenth year. Met with Qin at Linjin, Qin returned Puban to us.
cells.idiomatic: Seventeenth year. We met with Qin at Linjin, and Qin returned the city of Puban to us.

cells.content: 十。太子嬰與秦王會臨晉，因至咸陽而歸。
cells.literal: Tenth year. Crown Prince Ying met with the king of Qin at Linjin, then proceeded to Xianyang and returned.
cells.idiomatic: Tenth year. Crown Prince Ying met with the king of Qin at Linjin, then traveled on to Xianyang before returning home.

cells.content: 六。蜀反，司馬錯往誅蜀守煇，定蜀。日蝕，晝晦。伐楚。
cells.literal: Sixth year. Shu rebelled, Sima Cuo went to execute Shu governor Hui, pacified Shu. Solar eclipse, day darkened. Attacked Chu.
cells.idiomatic: Sixth year. Shu rebelled. Sima Cuo went and executed the Shu governor Hui, pacifying Shu. There was a solar eclipse that darkened the day. We attacked Chu.

cells.literal: Eighteenth year. With Qin attacked Chu.
cells.idiomatic: Eighteenth year. Together with Qin, we attacked Chu.

cells.content: 十一。秦取我穰。與秦擊楚。
cells.literal: Eleventh year. Qin took our Rang. With Qin attacked Chu.
cells.idiomatic: Eleventh year. Qin captured our city of Rang. Together with Qin, we attacked Chu.

cells.content: 二十五。趙攻中山。惠后卒。
cells.literal: Twenty-fifth year. Zhao attacked Zhongshan. Queen Hui died.
cells.idiomatic: Twenty-fifth year. Zhao attacked Zhongshan. Queen Hui died.

cells.content: 二十八。秦、韓、魏、齊敗我將軍唐眛於重丘。
cells.literal: Twenty-eighth year. Qin, Han, Wei, Qi defeated our general Tang Mei at Chongqiu.
cells.idiomatic: Twenty-eighth year. The states of Qin, Han, Wei, and Qi defeated our general Tang Mei at Chongqiu.

cells.content: 二十三。與秦擊楚，使公子將，大有功。
cells.literal: Twenty-third year. With Qin attacked Chu, sent prince as commander, achieved great merit.
cells.idiomatic: Twenty-third year. Together with Qin, we attacked Chu. We sent a prince to command the army, and he achieved great merit.

cells.content: 七。樗里疾卒。擊楚，斬首三萬。魏冉為相。
cells.literal: Seventh year. Chu Li Ji died. Attacked Chu, beheaded thirty thousand. Wei Ran became chancellor.
cells.idiomatic: Seventh year. Chu Li Ji died. We attacked the state of Chu and beheaded thirty thousand soldiers. Wei Ran became chancellor.

cells.content: 二十九。秦取我襄城，殺景缺。
cells.literal: Twenty-ninth year. Qin took our Xiangcheng, killed Jing Que.
cells.idiomatic: Twenty-ninth year. Qin captured our city of Xiangcheng and killed Jing Que.

cells.content: 二十四。秦使涇陽君來為質。
cells.literal: Twenty-fourth year. Qin sent Jingyang Jun to serve as hostage.
cells.idiomatic: Twenty-fourth year. Qin sent Lord Jingyang to serve as a hostage.

cells.literal: Eighth year. Chu king came, thereupon detained him.
cells.idiomatic: Eighth year. The king of Chu came to visit, and we detained him there.

cells.literal: Twentieth year. Met with Qi king at Han.
cells.idiomatic: Twentieth year. We met with the king of Qi in the state of Han.

cells.content: 十三。齊、魏王來。立咎為太子。
cells.literal: Thirteenth year. Qi and Wei kings came. Established Jiu as crown prince.
cells.idiomatic: Thirteenth year. The kings of Qi and Wei came to visit. We established Jiu as crown prince.

cells.content: 三十。王入秦。秦取我八城。
cells.literal: Thirtieth year. King entered Qin. Qin took our eight cities.
cells.idiomatic: Thirtieth year. The king entered Qin. Qin captured eight of our cities.

cells.content: 二十五。涇陽君復歸秦。薛文入相秦。
cells.literal: Twenty-fifth year. Jingyang Jun returned to Qin. Xue Wen entered to serve as chancellor of Qin.
cells.idiomatic: Twenty-fifth year. Lord Jingyang returned to the state of Qin. Xue Wen entered Qin to serve as chancellor.

cells.content: 二十一。與齊、韓共擊秦于函谷。河、渭絕一日。
cells.literal: Twenty-first year. Together with Qi and Han attacked Qin at Hangu Pass. Yellow River and Wei River cut off for one day.
cells.idiomatic: Twenty-first year. Together with Qi and Han, we attacked Qin at Hangu Pass. The Yellow River and Wei River were blocked for one day.

cells.literal: Fourteenth year. Together with Qi and Wei attacked Qin.
cells.idiomatic: Fourteenth year. Together with Qi and Wei, we attacked Qin.

cells.content: 趙惠文王元年。以公子勝為相，封平原君。
cells.literal: First year of King Huiwen of Zhao's reign. Appointed Prince Sheng as chancellor, enfeoffed him as Lord Pingyuan.
cells.idiomatic: This was the first year of King Huiwen of Zhao's reign. We appointed Prince Sheng as chancellor and enfeoffed him as Lord Pingyuan.

cells.content: 楚頃襄王元年。秦取我十六城
cells.literal: First year of King Qingxiang of Chu's reign. Qin took our sixteen cities.
cells.idiomatic: This was the first year of King Qingxiang of Chu's reign. Qin captured sixteen of our cities.

cells.content: 二十六。與魏、韓共擊秦。孟嘗君歸相齊。
cells.literal: Twenty-sixth year. Together with Wei and Han attacked Qin. Lord Mengchang returned to serve as chancellor of Qi.
cells.idiomatic: Twenty-sixth year. Together with the states of Wei and Han, we attacked Qin. Lord Mengchang returned to serve as chancellor of Qi.

cells.content: 十。楚懷王亡之趙，趙弗內。
cells.literal: Tenth year. Chu King Huai fled to Zhao, Zhao did not let him in.
cells.idiomatic: Tenth year. King Huai of Chu fled to Zhao, but Zhao refused to admit him.

cells.literal: Second year. Chu King Huai fled and came, did not let him in.
cells.idiomatic: Second year. King Huai of Chu fled here, but we refused to admit him.

cells.content: 十一。彗星見。復與魏封陵。
cells.literal: Eleventh year. Comet appeared. Again exchanged Fengling with Wei.
cells.idiomatic: Eleventh year. A comet appeared. We again exchanged the territory of Fengling with Wei.

cells.content: 十六。（與齊魏擊秦）秦與我武遂和。
cells.literal: Sixteenth year. (Together with Qi and Wei attacked Qin) Qin made peace with us over Wushui.
cells.idiomatic: Sixteenth year. (Together with Qi and Wei, we attacked Qin.) Qin made peace with us regarding the territory of Wushui.

cells.literal: Third year. King Huai died in Qin, came back for burial.
cells.idiomatic: Third year. King Huai died in Qin, and his body was returned for burial.

cells.content: 十二。樓緩免。穰侯魏冉為丞相。
cells.literal: Twelfth year. Lou Huan dismissed. Lord Rang Wei Ran became chancellor.
cells.idiomatic: Twelfth year. Lou Huan was dismissed. Lord Rang Wei Ran became chancellor.

cells.content: 魏昭王元年。秦尉錯來擊我襄。
cells.literal: First year of King Zhao of Wei's reign. Qin commander Cuo came to attack our Xiang.
cells.idiomatic: This was the first year of King Zhao of Wei's reign. Qin commander Cuo came to attack our city of Xiang.

cells.literal: First year of King Xi of Han's reign (Jiu)
cells.idiomatic: This was the first year of King Xi of Han's reign.

cells.content: 四。圍殺主父。與齊、燕共滅中山。
cells.literal: Fourth year. Besieged and killed the Lord Father. Together with Qi and Yan destroyed Zhongshan.
cells.idiomatic: Fourth year. We besieged and killed the Lord Father. Together with Qi and Yan, we destroyed the state of Zhongshan.

cells.literal: Fourth year. First year of Duke Wen of Lu's reign.
cells.idiomatic: Fourth year. This was the first year of Duke Wen of Lu's reign.

cells.literal: Twenty-ninth year. Assisted Zhao in destroying Zhongshan.
cells.idiomatic: Twenty-ninth year. We assisted Zhao in destroying the state of Zhongshan.

cells.literal: Thirteenth year. Appointed Ren Bi as governor of Hanzhong.
cells.idiomatic: Thirteenth year. We appointed Ren Bi as governor of Hanzhong.

cells.literal: Second year. Fought with Qin, we were disadvantaged.
cells.idiomatic: Second year. We fought with Qin, but we were at a disadvantage.

cells.content: 三十。田甲劫王，相薛文走。
cells.literal: Thirtieth year. Tian Jia kidnapped the king, chancellor Xue Wen fled.
cells.idiomatic: Thirtieth year. Tian Jia kidnapped the king, and Chancellor Xue Wen fled.

cells.content: 十四。白起擊伊闕，斬首二十四萬。
cells.literal: Fourteenth year. Bai Qi attacked Yique, beheaded two hundred forty thousand.
