cells.idiomatic: Fourteenth year. Bai Qi attacked the Yique pass and beheaded two hundred forty thousand soldiers.

cells.content: 三。佐韓擊秦，秦敗我兵伊闕。
cells.literal: Third year. Assisted Han in attacking Qin, Qin defeated our troops at Yique.
cells.idiomatic: Third year. We assisted Han in attacking Qin, but Qin defeated our troops at the Yique pass.

cells.content: 三。秦敗我伊闕，斬首二十四萬，虜將喜。
cells.literal: Third year. Qin defeated us at Yique, beheaded two hundred forty thousand, captured General Xi.
cells.idiomatic: Third year. Qin defeated our forces at the Yique pass, beheaded two hundred forty thousand soldiers, and captured General Xi.

cells.literal: Fifteenth year. Wei Ran dismissed as chancellor.
cells.idiomatic: Fifteenth year. Wei Ran was dismissed from his position as chancellor.

cells.literal: Seventh year. Welcomed bride from Qin.
cells.idiomatic: Seventh year. We welcomed a bride from Qin.

cells.literal: Fifth year. Qin captured our Yuancheng.
cells.idiomatic: Fifth year. Qin captured our city of Yuancheng.

cells.literal: Seventeenth year. Wei entered four hundred li of Hedong.
cells.idiomatic: Seventeenth year. Wei entered four hundred li of territory east of the Yellow River.

cells.literal: Sixth year. Mang Mao was valued for his deception.
cells.idiomatic: Sixth year. Mang Mao was highly regarded for his cunning and deception.

cells.content: 六。與秦武遂地方二百里。
cells.literal: Sixth year. Exchanged two hundred li of land in Wushui with Qin.
cells.idiomatic: Sixth year. We exchanged two hundred li of territory in Wushui with Qin.

cells.content: 十八。客卿錯擊魏，至軹，取城大小六十一。
cells.literal: Eighteenth year. Guest minister Cuo attacked Wei, reached Zhi, captured large and small cities sixty-one.
cells.idiomatic: Eighteenth year. The guest minister Cuo attacked Wei, reached the city of Zhi, and captured sixty-one cities of various sizes.

cells.content: 七。秦擊我。取城大小六十一。
cells.literal: Seventh year. Qin attacked us. Captured large and small cities sixty-one.
cells.idiomatic: Seventh year. Qin attacked us and captured sixty-one cities of various sizes.

cells.content: 十九。十月為帝，十二月復為王。任鄙卒。
cells.literal: Nineteenth year. Became emperor in tenth month, reverted to king in twelfth month. Ren Bi died.
cells.idiomatic: Nineteenth year. He became emperor in the tenth month, but reverted to king in the twelfth month. Ren Bi died.

cells.literal: Eleventh year. Qin captured our Guiyang.
cells.idiomatic: Eleventh year. Qin captured our city of Guiyang.

cells.content: 三十六。為東帝二月，復為王。
cells.literal: Thirty-sixth year. Served as Eastern Emperor for two months, then reverted to king.
cells.idiomatic: Thirty-sixth year. He served as the Eastern Emperor for two months, then reverted to being king.

cells.content: 九。秦拔我新垣、曲陽之城。
cells.literal: Ninth year. Qin captured our cities of Xinyuan and Quyang.
cells.idiomatic: Ninth year. Qin captured our cities of Xinyuan and Quyang.

cells.content: 二十一。魏納安邑及河內。
cells.literal: Twenty-first year. Wei accepted Anyi and Henan.
cells.idiomatic: Twenty-first year. Wei accepted the territories of Anyi and Henan.

cells.literal: Tenth year. Song king died in our Wen.
cells.idiomatic: Tenth year. The king of Song died in our city of Wen.

cells.literal: Tenth year. Qin defeated our troops at Xiashan.
cells.idiomatic: Tenth year. Qin defeated our troops at Xiashan.
Thirty-eighth year. Qi destroyed the state of Song.

cells.literal: Twenty-second year. Meng Wu attacked Qi.
cells.idiomatic: Twenty-second year. Meng Wu attacked Qi.

cells.literal: Fourteenth year. Met with Qin at Zhongyang.
cells.idiomatic: Fourteenth year. We met with Qin at Zhongyang.

cells.literal: Fourteenth year. Met with Qin at Wan.
cells.idiomatic: Fourteenth year. We met with Qin at Wan.

cells.literal: Thirty-ninth year. Qin captured nine of our cities.
cells.idiomatic: Thirty-ninth year. Qin captured nine of our cities.

cells.content: 二十三。尉斯離與韓、魏、燕、趙共擊齊，破之。
cells.literal: Twenty-third year. Wei Si Li together with Han, Wei, Yan, Zhao attacked Qi and defeated them.
cells.idiomatic: Twenty-third year. Wei Si Li, together with the states of Han, Wei, Yan, and Zhao, attacked Qi and defeated them.

cells.content: 十二。與秦擊齊濟西。與秦王會西周。
cells.literal: Twelfth year. With Qin attacked Qi at Jixi. Met with Qin king at Xizhou.
cells.idiomatic: Twelfth year. Together with Qin, we attacked Qi at Jixi. We met with the king of Qin at Xizhou.

cells.content: 十二。與秦擊齊濟西。與秦王會西周。
cells.literal: Twelfth year. With Qin attacked Qi at Jixi. Met with Qin king at Xizhou.
cells.idiomatic: Twelfth year. Together with Qin, we attacked Qi at Jixi. We met with the king of Qin at Xizhou.
Fifteenth year. We captured Qi's city of Xiyang.
Fifteenth year. We captured Qi's territory north of the Huai River.

cells.content: 二十八。與秦、三晉擊齊，燕獨入至臨菑，取其寶器。
cells.literal: Twenty-eighth year. Together with Qin and the three Jin states attacked Qi, Yan alone entered Linzi and took their precious vessels.
cells.idiomatic: Twenty-eighth year. Together with Qin and the three Jin states, we attacked Qi. Yan alone entered Linzi and took their precious vessels.

cells.content: 四十。五國共擊湣王，王走莒。
cells.literal: Fortieth year. Five states together attacked King Min, the king fled to Ju.
cells.idiomatic: Fortieth year. Five states together attacked King Min, who fled to Ju.

cells.literal: Twenty-fourth year. Met with Chu at Rang.
cells.idiomatic: Twenty-fourth year. We met with Chu at Rang.

cells.content: 十三。秦拔我安城，兵至大梁而還。
cells.literal: Thirteenth year. Qin captured our Ancheng, troops reached Daxiang and returned.
cells.idiomatic: Thirteenth year. Qin captured our city of Ancheng. Qin's troops reached the city of Daxiang but then returned.

cells.literal: Sixteenth year. Met with Qin king at Rang.
cells.idiomatic: Sixteenth year. We met with the king of Qin at Rang.

cells.literal: First year of King Xiang of Qi's reign (Fa Zhang)
cells.idiomatic: This was the first year of King Xiang of Qi's reign.

cells.literal: Fourteenth year. Great flood. First year of Marquis Huai of Wei's reign.
cells.idiomatic: Fourteenth year. There was a great flood. This was the first year of Marquis Huai of Wei's reign.

cells.literal: Fourteenth year. Met with Qin between the two Zhou states.
cells.idiomatic: Fourteenth year. We met with Qin in the area between the two Zhou states.

cells.literal: Seventeenth year. Qin captured our two cities.
cells.idiomatic: Seventeenth year. Qin captured two of our cities.

cells.literal: Twenty-sixth year. Wei Ran again became chancellor.
cells.idiomatic: Twenty-sixth year. Wei Ran again became chancellor.

cells.literal: Eighteenth year. Qin captured our Shicheng.
cells.idiomatic: Eighteenth year. Qin captured our city of Shicheng.

cells.content: 二十七。擊趙，斬首三萬。地動，壞城。
cells.literal: Twenty-seventh year. Attacked Zhao, beheaded thirty thousand. Earthquake, destroyed city.
cells.idiomatic: Twenty-seventh year. We attacked Zhao and beheaded thirty thousand soldiers. There was an earthquake that destroyed a city.

cells.content: 十九。秦敗我軍，斬首三萬。
cells.literal: Nineteenth year. Qin defeated our army, beheaded thirty thousand.
cells.idiomatic: Nineteenth year. Qin defeated our army and beheaded thirty thousand soldiers.

cells.content: 十九。秦擊我，與秦漢北及上庸地。
cells.literal: Nineteenth year. Qin attacked us, ceded to Qin the lands north of Han and Shangyong.
cells.idiomatic: Nineteenth year. Qin attacked us, so we ceded to Qin the territories north of the Han River and Shangyong.

cells.content: 二十。與秦會黽池，藺相如從。
cells.literal: Twentieth year. Met with Qin at Mengchi, Lin Xiangru accompanied.
cells.idiomatic: Twentieth year. We met with Qin at Mengchi, accompanied by Lin Xiangru.

cells.literal: Twentieth year. Qin captured Chong and Xiling.
cells.idiomatic: Twentieth year. Qin captured our cities of Chong and Xiling.

cells.literal: Fifth year. Killed Yan's Ji Jie.
cells.idiomatic: Fifth year. We killed Yan's general Ji Jie.

cells.content: 二十九。白起擊楚，拔郢，更東至竟陵，以為南郡。
cells.literal: Twenty-ninth year. Bai Qi attacked Chu, captured Ying, then moved east to Jingling, made it Nanguo commandery.
cells.idiomatic: Twenty-ninth year. Bai Qi attacked Chu, captured the capital Ying, then moved further east to Jingling and established it as Nanguo commandery.

cells.content: 二十一。秦拔我郢，燒夷陵，王亡走陳。
cells.literal: Twenty-first year. Qin captured our Ying, burned Yiling, king fled to Chen.
cells.idiomatic: Twenty-first year. Qin captured our capital Ying, burned Yiling, and the king fled to Chen.

cells.literal: First year of King Hui of Yan's reign.
cells.idiomatic: This was the first year of King Hui of Yan's reign.

cells.literal: Thirtieth year. Bai Qi enfeoffed as Lord Wu'an.
cells.idiomatic: Thirtieth year. Bai Qi was enfeoffed as Lord Wu'an.

cells.literal: Twenty-second year. Qin captured our Wu and Qianzhong.
cells.idiomatic: Twenty-second year. Qin captured our territories of Wu and Qianzhong.

cells.content: 魏安釐王元年。秦拔我兩城。封弟公子無忌為信陵君。
cells.literal: First year of King Anli of Wei's reign. Qin captured our two cities. Enfeoffed younger brother Prince Wuji as Lord Xinling.
cells.idiomatic: This was the first year of King Anli of Wei's reign. Qin captured two of our cities. We enfeoffed our younger brother Prince Wuji as Lord Xinling.

cells.content: 二十三。秦所拔我江旁反秦。
cells.literal: Twenty-third year. Cities Qin captured along the Jiang River rebelled against Qin.
cells.idiomatic: Twenty-third year. The cities that Qin had captured along the Jiang River rebelled against Qin.

cells.content: 二。秦拔我兩城，軍大梁下，韓來救，與秦溫以和。
cells.literal: Second year. Qin captured our two cities, army under Daxiang, Han came to rescue, made peace with Qin at Wen.
cells.idiomatic: Second year. Qin captured two of our cities and positioned their army under the city of Daxiang. Han came to rescue us, and we made peace with Qin at Wen.

cells.content: 二十一。暴鳶救魏，為秦所敗，走開封。
cells.literal: Twenty-first year. Bao Yuan rescued Wei, was defeated by Qin, fled to Kaifeng.
cells.idiomatic: Twenty-first year. Bao Yuan went to rescue the state of Wei but was defeated by Qin and fled to the city of Kaifeng.

cells.content: 三。秦拔我四城，斬首四萬。
cells.literal: Third year. Qin captured our four cities, beheaded forty thousand.
cells.idiomatic: Third year. Qin captured four of our cities and beheaded forty thousand soldiers.

cells.content: 三十四。白起擊魏華陽軍，芒卯走，得三晉將，斬首十五萬。
cells.literal: Thirty-four. Bai Qi struck Wei's Huayang army, Mang Mao fled, obtained the generals of the Three Jins, beheaded one hundred fifty thousand.
cells.idiomatic: Thirty-fourth year. Bai Qi attacked Wei's forces at Huayang. General Mang Mao fled. Qin captured the generals of the Three Jin states and beheaded one hundred fifty thousand soldiers.

cells.literal: Four. Made peace with Qin by giving Nanyang.
cells.idiomatic: Fourth year. We made peace with Qin by ceding Nanyang.

cells.literal: Han Huan Hui Wang first year
cells.idiomatic: First year of King Huan Hui of Han began.

cells.content: 二十七。擊燕。魯頃公元年。
cells.literal: Twenty-seven. Struck Yan. Lu Qing Gong first year.
cells.idiomatic: Twenty-seventh year. We attacked Yan. First year of Duke Qing of Lu.

cells.content: 二十八。藺相如攻齊，至平邑。
cells.literal: Twenty-eight. Lin Xiangru attacked Qi, reached Pingyi.
cells.idiomatic: Twenty-eighth year. Chancellor Lin Xiangru attacked Qi and reached Pingyi.

cells.literal: Yan Wu Cheng Wang first year
cells.idiomatic: First year of King Wu Cheng of Yan began.

cells.literal: Three. Qin struck our Yan Yu city, did not capture.
cells.idiomatic: Third year. Qin attacked our city of Yanyu but failed to capture it.

cells.content: 二十九。秦攻韓閼與。趙奢將擊秦，大敗之，賜號曰馬服。
cells.literal: Twenty-nine. Qin attacked Han Yanyu. Zhao She led and struck Qin, greatly defeated them, granted title called Ma Fu.
cells.idiomatic: Twenty-ninth year. Qin attacked Han's Yanyu. General Zhao She led forces against Qin and decisively defeated them. He was granted the title Lord Ma Fu.

cells.literal: Fourteen. Qin, Chu struck our Gang Shou.
cells.idiomatic: Fourteenth year. Qin and Chu attacked our Gangshou.

cells.literal: Nine. Qin captured our Huai city.
cells.idiomatic: Ninth year. Qin captured our city of Huai.

cells.content: 四十。太子質於魏者死，歸葬芷陽。
cells.literal: Forty. Crown Prince hostage in Wei died, returned and buried in Zhiyang.
cells.idiomatic: Fortieth year. The crown prince who had been a hostage in Wei died. His remains were returned and buried in Zhiyang.
Eleventh year. Qin captured our city of Linqiu.

cells.content: 四十二。宣太后薨。安國君為太子。
cells.literal: Forty-two. Empress Dowager Xuan died. Lord Anguo became crown prince.
cells.idiomatic: Forty-second year. Empress Dowager Xuan passed away. Lord Anguo was made the crown prince.

cells.content: 趙孝成王元年。秦拔我三城。平原君相。
cells.literal: Zhao Xiao Cheng Wang first year. Qin captured our three cities. Lord Pingyuan became chancellor.
cells.idiomatic: First year of King Xiao Cheng of Zhao. Qin captured three of our cities. Lord Pingyuan became the chancellor.

cells.literal: Seven. Qi Tian Dan captured Zhongyang.
cells.idiomatic: Seventh year. Tian Dan of Qi captured Zhongyang.

cells.literal: Nine. Qin captured our Xing. Fortified beside the Fen.
cells.idiomatic: Ninth year. Qin captured our city of Xing. We fortified positions along the Fen River.
First year of King Jian of Qi began.
Forty-fourth year. Qin attacked Han and captured Nanyang.
Tenth year. Qin attacked our Taihang region.

cells.literal: Forty-five. (Qin) attacked Han, took ten cities.
cells.idiomatic: Forty-fifth year. Qin attacked Han and captured ten cities.

cells.content: 楚考烈王元年。秦取我州。黃歇為相。
cells.literal: Chu Kao Lie Wang first year. Qin took our Zhou. Huang Xie became chancellor.
cells.idiomatic: First year of King Kao Lie of Chu. Qin captured our Zhou region. Huang Xie became the chancellor.

cells.literal: Forty-six. The king went to Nanzheng.
cells.idiomatic: Forty-sixth year. The king moved to Nanzheng.

cells.literal: Five. Sent Lian Po to resist Qin at Changping.
cells.idiomatic: Fifth year. We sent Lian Po to resist Qin at Changping.

cells.content: 四十七。白起破趙長平，殺卒四十五萬。
cells.literal: Forty-seven. Bai Qi broke Zhao at Changping, killed soldiers four hundred fifty thousand.
cells.idiomatic: Forty-seventh year. General Bai Qi defeated the state of Zhao at Changping and slaughtered four hundred fifty thousand soldiers.

cells.content: 六。使趙括代廉頗將。白起破括四十五萬。
cells.literal: Six. Sent Zhao Kuo to replace Lian Po as general. Bai Qi broke Zhao Kuo forty-five thousand.
cells.idiomatic: Sixth year. We sent Zhao Kuo to replace General Lian Po as commander. General Bai Qi defeated the general Zhao Kuo and slaughtered forty-five thousand soldiers.

cells.content: 五十。王齕、鄭安平圍邯鄲，及齕還軍，拔新中。
cells.literal: Year 50. Wang He and Zheng Anping besieged Handan, and when He withdrew his army, they captured Xinzhong.
cells.idiomatic: In the fiftieth year, Wang He and Zheng Anping laid siege to Handan. When He withdrew his forces, they captured Xinzhong.

cells.content: 二十。公子無忌救邯鄲，秦兵解去。
cells.literal: Year 20. Lord Wuwei rescued Handan, the Qin army withdrew.
cells.idiomatic: In the twentieth year, Lord Wuwei came to Handan's rescue, forcing the Qin army to withdraw.

cells.content: 九。秦圍我邯鄲，楚、魏救我。
cells.literal: Year 9. Qin besieged our Handan, Chu and Wei rescued us.
cells.idiomatic: In the ninth year, Qin forces besieged our Handan, but Chu and Wei came to our aid.
In the sixth year, Lord Chunshen came to Zhao's rescue.

cells.literal: First year of King Xiao of Yan
cells.idiomatic: This marked the first year of King Xiao of Yan's reign.
In the fifty-ninth year, King Nan passed away.

cells.content: 二十一。韓、魏、楚救趙新中，秦兵罷。
cells.literal: Year 21. Han, Wei, Chu rescued Zhao's Xinzhong, Qin army withdrew.
cells.idiomatic: In the twenty-first year, Han, Wei, and Chu forces rescued Zhao's Xinzhong, causing the Qin army to withdraw.

cells.content: 十七。秦擊我陽城，救趙新中。
cells.literal: Year 17. Qin attacked our Yangcheng to rescue Zhao's Xinzhong.
cells.idiomatic: In the seventeenth year, Qin forces attacked our Yangcheng in order to rescue Zhao's Xinzhong.
In the seventh year, they rescued Zhao's Xinzhong.

cells.content: 五十二。。取西周。王稽棄市。
cells.literal: Year 52. Took Western Zhou. Wang Ji was executed in the marketplace.
cells.idiomatic: In the fifty-second year, they conquered Western Zhou. Wang Ji was executed in the marketplace.

cells.literal: Year 8. Took Lu, the Lord of Lu was enfeoffed in Ju.
cells.idiomatic: In the eighth year, they conquered Lu. The Lord of Lu was enfeoffed in Ju.

cells.literal: First year of King Xi of Yan
cells.idiomatic: This marked the first year of King Xi of Yan's reign.
In the tenth year, they moved to Juyang.

cells.literal: Year 25. First year of Marquis Yuan of Wei.
cells.idiomatic: In the twenty-fifth year, this marked the first year of Marquis Yuan of Wei's reign.
In the fifteenth year, Lord Pingyuan passed away.
In the twelfth year, Chancellor Jing Bo passed away.

cells.content: 四。伐趙，趙破我軍，殺栗腹。
cells.literal: Year 4. Attacked Zhao, Zhao broke our army, killed Li Fu.
cells.idiomatic: In the fourth year, we attacked Zhao. Zhao broke our army and killed Li Fu.

cells.literal: First year of King Xiaowen of Qin.
cells.idiomatic: This marked the first year of King Xiaowen of Qin's reign.

cells.content: 秦莊襄王楚元年。。蒙驁取成皋、滎陽。初置三川郡。呂不韋相。取東周。
cells.literal: First year of King Zhuangxiang of Qin from Chu. Meng Ao took Chenggao and Xingyang. For the first time established Sanchuan commandery. Lü Buwei became chancellor. Took Eastern Zhou.
cells.idiomatic: This marked the first year of King Zhuangxiang of Qin's reign, who came from Chu. Meng Ao captured Chenggao and Xingyang. Sanchuan commandery was established for the first time. Lü Buwei became chancellor. They conquered Eastern Zhou.

cells.content: 二十四。秦拔我成皋、滎陽。
cells.literal: Year 24. Qin captured our Chenggao and Xingyang.
cells.idiomatic: In the twenty-fourth year, Qin forces captured our Chenggao and Xingyang.

cells.content: 十四。楚滅魯，頃公遷卞，為家人，絕祀。
cells.literal: Year 14. Chu extinguished Lu, Duke Qing moved to Bi, became a commoner, sacrifices ended.
cells.idiomatic: In the fourteenth year, Chu conquered Lu. Duke Qing was moved to Bi, reduced to commoner status, and the royal sacrifices ceased.

cells.content: 二。蒙驁擊趙榆次、新城、狼孟，得三十七城。日蝕。
cells.literal: Year 2. Meng Ao attacked Zhao's Yuci, Xincheng, Langmeng, obtained thirty-seven cities. Solar eclipse.
cells.idiomatic: In the second year, Meng Ao attacked Zhao's Yuci, Xincheng, and Langmeng, capturing thirty-seven cities. There was a solar eclipse.

cells.literal: Year 15. Lord Chunshen moved his fief to Wu.
cells.idiomatic: In the fifteenth year, Lord Chunshen had his fief moved to Wu.

cells.content: 三。王齮擊上黨。初置太原郡。魏公子無忌率五國卻我軍河外，蒙驁解去，
cells.literal: Year 3. Wang Xi attacked Shangdang. For the first time established Taiyuan commandery. Wei's Lord Wuwei led five states to drive our army back beyond the Yellow River, Meng Ao withdrew.
cells.idiomatic: In the third year, Wang Xi attacked Shangdang. Taiyuan commandery was established for the first time. Lord Wuwei of Wei led forces from five states to drive our army back across the Yellow River, forcing Meng Ao to withdraw.

cells.content: 三十。無忌率五國兵敗秦軍河外。
cells.literal: Year 30. Wuwei led five states' armies to defeat Qin forces beyond the Yellow River.
cells.idiomatic: In the thirtieth year, Wuwei led armies from five states to defeat Qin forces across the Yellow River.
In the twenty-sixth year, Qin forces captured our Shangdang.

cells.content: 始皇帝元年。。擊取晉陽，作鄭國渠。
cells.literal: First year of the First Emperor. Attacked and took Jinyang, built the Zhengguo Canal.
cells.idiomatic: This marked the first year of the First Emperor's reign. He attacked and captured Jinyang, and had the Zhengguo Canal built.
In the twentieth year, Qin forces captured our Jinyang.

cells.content: 三。蒙驁擊韓，取十三城。王齮死。
cells.literal: Year 3. Meng Ao attacked Han, took thirteen cities. Wang Xi died.
cells.idiomatic: In the third year, Meng Ao attacked Han and captured thirteen cities. Wang Xi died.

cells.literal: Year 29. Qin captured our thirteen cities.
cells.idiomatic: In the twenty-ninth year, Qin forces captured our thirteen cities.

cells.literal: First year of King Daoxiang of Zhao (Yan).
cells.idiomatic: This marked the first year of King Daoxiang of Zhao's reign.

cells.content: 四。七月，蝗蔽天下。百姓納粟千石，拜爵一級。
cells.literal: Year 4. In the seventh month, locusts covered the entire world. Commoners who contributed one thousand bushels of grain were granted one rank of nobility.
cells.idiomatic: In the fourth year, locusts blotted out the sky in the seventh month. Commoners who donated one thousand bushels of grain were ennobled by one rank.
In the thirty-fourth year, Lord Xinling passed away.

cells.literal: Year 2. The crown prince returned from being a hostage in Qin.
cells.idiomatic: In the second year, the crown prince returned from his hostage service in Qin.

cells.literal: Year 12. Zhao captured our Wushui and Fangcheng.
cells.idiomatic: In the twelfth year, Zhao forces captured our Wushui and Fangcheng.

cells.content: 五。蒙驁取魏酸棗二十城。初置東郡。
cells.literal: Year 5. Meng Ao took Wei's Suanzhao twenty cities. For the first time established Dong commandery.
cells.idiomatic: In the fifth year, Meng Ao captured twenty cities including Wei's Suanzhao. Dong commandery was established for the first time.

cells.content: 魏景湣王元年。秦拔我二十城。
cells.literal: First year of King Jingmin of Wei. Qin captured our twenty cities.
cells.idiomatic: This marked the first year of King Jingmin of Wei's reign. Qin forces captured our twenty cities.

cells.literal: Year 3. The chancellor of Zhao and chancellor of Wei met at Ke and formed an alliance.
cells.idiomatic: In the third year, the chancellors of Zhao and Wei met at Ke and concluded an alliance.

cells.literal: Year 13. Ju Xin died in Zhao.
cells.idiomatic: In the thirteenth year, Ju Xin died in Zhao.

cells.literal: Year 6. Five states jointly attacked Qin.
cells.idiomatic: In the sixth year, five states launched a joint attack against Qin.

cells.content: 二。秦拔我朝歌。衛從濮陽徙野王。
cells.literal: Year 2. Qin captured our Zhaoge. Wei moved from Puyang to Yewang.
cells.idiomatic: In the second year, Qin forces captured our Zhaoge. Wei relocated from Puyang to Yewang.

cells.content: 二十二。王東徙壽春，命曰郢。
cells.literal: Year 22. The king moved east to Shouchun and renamed it Ying.
cells.idiomatic: In the twenty-second year, the king moved his capital east to Shouchun and renamed it Ying.

cells.content: 七。彗星見北方西方。夏太后薨。蒙驁死。
cells.literal: Year 7. Comet appeared in the northwest. Empress Xia died. Meng Ao died.
cells.idiomatic: In the seventh year, a comet appeared in the northwest. Empress Xia passed away. Meng Ao died.
In the third year, Qin forces attacked our Ji.

cells.literal: Year 8. Lao Ai was enfeoffed as Marquis of Changxin.
cells.idiomatic: In the eighth year, Lao Ai was enfeoffed as the Marquis of Changxin.

cells.content: 九。彗星見，竟天。嫪毐為亂，遷其舍人于蜀。彗星復見。
cells.literal: Year 9. Comet appeared, spanning the sky. Lao Ai rebelled, his retainers were exiled to Shu. Comet appeared again.
cells.idiomatic: In the ninth year, a comet appeared spanning the entire sky. Lao Ai rebelled, and his retainers were exiled to Shu. The comet appeared again.

cells.literal: Year 5. Qin captured our Yuan, Puyang, Yan.
cells.idiomatic: In the fifth year, Qin forces captured our Yuan, Puyang, and Yan.

cells.literal: First year of King An of Han
cells.idiomatic: This marked the first year of King An of Han's reign.

cells.literal: Year 25. Li Yuan assassinated Lord Chunshen.
cells.idiomatic: In the twenty-fifth year, Li Yuan assassinated Lord Chunshen.

cells.content: 十。相國呂不韋免。齊、趙來，置酒。太后入咸陽。大索。
cells.literal: Year 10. Chancellor Lü Buwei was dismissed. Qi and Zhao came, wine was served. The Empress Dowager entered Xianyang. Great search.
cells.idiomatic: In the tenth year, Chancellor Lü Buwei was dismissed. Envoys from Qi and Zhao arrived, and wine was served. The Empress Dowager entered Xianyang. A great search was conducted.

cells.literal: Year 8. Entered Qin, wine was served.
cells.idiomatic: In the eighth year, they entered Qin and wine was served.

cells.literal: First year of King You of Chu (Zhao)
cells.idiomatic: This marked the first year of King You of Chu's reign.

cells.literal: Year 28. Entered Qin, wine was served.
cells.idiomatic: In the twenty-eighth year, they entered Qin and wine was served.

cells.content: 十一。呂不韋之河南。王翦擊鄴、閼與，取九城。
cells.literal: Year 11. Lü Buwei went to Henan. Wang Jian attacked Ye and Yan, took nine cities.
cells.idiomatic: In the eleventh year, Lü Buwei went to Henan. Wang Jian attacked Ye and Yan, capturing nine cities.

cells.content: 九。秦拔我閼與、鄴，取九城。
cells.literal: Year 9. Qin captured our Yan and Ye, took nine cities.
cells.idiomatic: In the ninth year, Qin forces captured our Yan and Ye, taking nine cities.

cells.content: 十二。發四郡兵助魏擊楚。呂不韋卒。復嫪毐舍人遷蜀者。
cells.literal: Year 12. Dispatched troops from four commanderies to assist Wei in attacking Chu. Lü Buwei died. Restored those retainers of Lao Ai who had been exiled to Shu.
cells.idiomatic: In the twelfth year, troops from four commanderies were dispatched to assist Wei in attacking Chu. Lü Buwei died. The retainers of Lao Ai who had been exiled to Shu were restored.

cells.literal: Year 8. Qin assisted us in attacking Chu.
cells.idiomatic: In the eighth year, Qin assisted us in attacking Chu.

cells.literal: First year of King Qian of Zhao.
cells.idiomatic: This marked the first year of King Qian of Zhao's reign.

cells.literal: Year 3. Qin and Wei attacked us.
cells.idiomatic: In the third year, Qin and Wei attacked us.

cells.content: 十三。桓齮擊平陽，殺趙扈輒，斬首十萬，因東擊。趙王之河南。彗星見。
cells.literal: Year 13. Huan Qi attacked Pingyang, killed Zhao's Hu Zhe, beheaded one hundred thousand, then attacked eastward. The King of Zhao went to Henan. A comet appeared.
cells.idiomatic: In the thirteenth year, Huan Qi attacked Pingyang, killed Zhao's Hu Zhe, and beheaded one hundred thousand men. He then attacked eastward. The King of Zhao went to Henan. A comet appeared.

cells.content: 二。秦拔我平陽，敗扈輒，。斬首十萬。
cells.literal: Year 2. Qin captured our Pingyang, defeated Hu Zhe, beheaded one hundred thousand.
cells.idiomatic: In the second year, Qin forces captured our Pingyang, defeated Hu Zhe, and beheaded one hundred thousand men.

cells.content: 十四。桓齮定平陽、武城、宜安。韓使非來，我殺非。韓王請為臣。
cells.literal: Year 14. Huan Qi pacified Pingyang, Wucheng, Yian. Han envoy Fei came, we killed Fei. The King of Han requested to become a vassal.
cells.idiomatic: In the fourteenth year, Huan Qi pacified Pingyang, Wucheng, and Yian. Han envoy Fei came, and we killed him. The King of Han requested to become our vassal.
In the third year, Qin forces captured our Yian.

cells.content: 十五。興軍至鄴。軍至太原。取狼孟。
cells.literal: Year 15. Raised army to Ye. Army reached Taiyuan. Took Langmeng.
cells.idiomatic: In the fifteenth year, we raised an army to Ye. The army reached Taiyuan. We took Langmeng.

cells.content: 四。秦拔我狼孟、鄱吾，。軍鄴。
cells.literal: Year 4. Qin captured our Langmeng and Pengwu. Army at Ye.
cells.idiomatic: In the fourth year, Qin forces captured our Langmeng and Pengwu. The army was stationed at Ye.

cells.content: 二十三。太子丹質於秦，亡來歸。
cells.literal: Year 23. Crown Prince Dan was hostage in Qin, fled and returned.
cells.idiomatic: In the twenty-third year, Crown Prince Dan, who was a hostage in Qin, fled and returned home.

cells.content: 十六。置麗邑。發卒受韓南陽。
cells.literal: Year 16. Established Liyi. Dispatched troops to receive Han's Nanyang.
cells.idiomatic: In the sixteenth year, we established Liyi. Troops were dispatched to receive Han's Nanyang territory.
In the twelfth year, we offered cities to Qin.

cells.literal: Year 8. Qin came to receive territory.
cells.idiomatic: In the eighth year, Qin came to receive our territory.
In the fifth year, there was a great earthquake.

cells.content: 十七。內史騰擊得韓王安，盡取其地，置潁川郡。華陽太后薨。
cells.literal: Year 17. Palace Secretary Teng attacked and captured King An of Han, took all his territory, established Yingchuan commandery. Empress Hua Yang died.
cells.idiomatic: In the seventeenth year, Palace Secretary Teng attacked and captured King An of Han, taking all his territory and establishing Yingchuan commandery. Empress Hua Yang passed away.

cells.literal: Year 9. Qin captured King An, Qin extinguished Han.
cells.idiomatic: In the ninth year, Qin captured King An and extinguished the state of Han.

cells.literal: Year 14. First year of Lord Jiao of Wei.
cells.idiomatic: In the fourteenth year, this marked the first year of Lord Jiao of Wei's reign.

cells.content: 十九。王翦拔趙，虜王遷邯鄲。帝太后薨。
cells.literal: Year 19. Wang Jian conquered Zhao, captured King Qian at Handan. Empress Dowager died.
cells.idiomatic: In the nineteenth year, Wang Jian conquered Zhao and captured King Qian at Handan. The Empress Dowager passed away.

cells.content: 八。秦王翦虜王遷邯鄲。公子嘉自立為代王。
cells.literal: Year 8. Qin general Wang Jian captured King Qian at Handan. Prince Jia established himself as King of Dai.
cells.idiomatic: In the eighth year, Qin general Wang Jian captured King Qian at Handan. Prince Jia established himself as King of Dai.

cells.content: 十。幽王卒，弟郝立，為哀王。三月，負芻殺哀王。
cells.literal: Year 10. King You died, his younger brother Hao ascended, became King Ai. In the third month, Fu Chu assassinated King Ai.
cells.idiomatic: In the tenth year, King You died. His younger brother Hao ascended the throne and became King Ai. In the third month, Fu Chu assassinated King Ai.

cells.content: 二十。燕太子使荊軻刺王，覺之。王翦將擊燕。
cells.literal: Year 20. Yan crown prince sent Jing Ke to assassinate the king, but it was discovered. Wang Jian will attack Yan.
cells.idiomatic: In the twentieth year, the Yan crown prince sent Jing Ke to assassinate the king, but the plot was discovered. Wang Jian prepared to attack Yan.

cells.literal: First year of King Jia of Wei
cells.idiomatic: This marked the first year of King Jia of Wei's reign.

cells.literal: First year of King Jia of Dai
cells.idiomatic: This marked the first year of King Jia of Dai's reign.

cells.content: 楚王負芻元年。負芻，哀王庶兄。
cells.literal: First year of King Fu Chu of Chu. Fu Chu was the half-brother of King Ai.
cells.idiomatic: This marked the first year of King Fu Chu of Chu's reign. Fu Chu was the half-brother of King Ai.

cells.content: 二十八。太子丹使荊軻刺秦王，秦伐我。
cells.literal: Year 28. Crown Prince Dan sent Jing Ke to assassinate the Qin king, Qin attacked us.
cells.idiomatic: In the twenty-eighth year, Crown Prince Dan sent Jing Ke to assassinate the Qin king, prompting Qin to attack us.
In the twenty-first year, Wang Ben attacked Chu.

cells.literal: Year 2. Qin greatly defeated us, took ten cities.
cells.idiomatic: In the second year, Qin inflicted a major defeat on us and captured ten cities.

cells.content: 二十九。秦拔我薊，得太子丹。王徙遼東。
cells.literal: Year 29. Qin captured our Ji, got Crown Prince Dan. The king moved to Liaodong.
cells.idiomatic: In the twenty-ninth year, Qin captured our Ji and apprehended Crown Prince Dan. The king fled to Liaodong.

cells.content: 二十二。王賁擊魏，得其王假，盡取其地。
cells.literal: Year 22. Wang Ben attacked Wei, got their King Jia, took all their territory.
cells.idiomatic: In the twenty-second year, Wang Ben attacked Wei, captured King Jia, and took all of Wei's territory.
In the third year, Qin captured King Jia.

cells.content: 二十三。王翦、蒙武擊破楚軍，殺其將項燕。
cells.literal: Year 23. Wang Jian and Meng Wu broke the Chu army, killed their general Xiang Yan.
cells.idiomatic: In the twenty-third year, Wang Jian and Meng Wu routed the Chu army and killed their general Xiang Yan.

cells.literal: Year 4. Qin broke our general Xiang Yan.
cells.idiomatic: In the fourth year, Qin defeated our general Xiang Yan.

cells.content: 二十四。王翦、蒙武破楚，虜其王負芻。
cells.literal: Year 24. Wang Jian and Meng Wu broke Chu, captured their King Fu Chu.
cells.idiomatic: In the twenty-fourth year, Wang Jian and Meng Wu conquered Chu and captured King Fu Chu.

cells.literal: Year 5. Qin captured King Fu Chu. Qin extinguished Chu.
cells.idiomatic: In the fifth year, Qin captured King Fu Chu and extinguished the state of Chu.

cells.content: 二十五。王賁擊燕，虜王喜。又擊得代王嘉。五月，天下大酺。
cells.literal: Year 25. Wang Ben attacked Yan, captured King Xi. Also attacked and got King Jia of Dai. In the fifth month, great feast for all under heaven.
cells.idiomatic: In the twenty-fifth year, Wang Ben attacked Yan and captured King Xi. He also attacked and captured King Jia of Dai. In the fifth month, there was a great feast for all under heaven.

cells.content: 六。秦將王賁虜王嘉，秦滅趙。
cells.literal: Year 6. Qin general Wang Ben captured King Jia, Qin extinguished Zhao.
cells.idiomatic: In the sixth year, Qin general Wang Ben captured King Jia and extinguished the state of Zhao.

cells.content: 三十三。秦虜王喜，拔遼東，秦滅燕。
cells.literal: Year 33. Qin captured King Xi, took Liaodong, Qin extinguished Yan.
cells.idiomatic: In the thirty-third year, Qin captured King Xi, took Liaodong, and extinguished the state of Yan.

cells.content: 二十六。王賁擊齊，虜王建。初并天下，立為皇帝。
cells.literal: Year 26. Wang Ben attacked Qi, captured King Jian. For the first time united all under heaven, established as emperor.
cells.idiomatic: In the twenty-sixth year, Wang Ben attacked Qi and captured King Jian. For the first time, all under heaven was united and the emperor was established.

cells.content: 四十四。秦虜王建。秦滅齊。
cells.literal: Year 44. Qin captured King Jian. Qin extinguished Qi.
cells.idiomatic: In the forty-fourth year, Qin captured King Jian and extinguished the state of Qi.

cells.content: 二十七更命河為「德水」。為金人十二。命民曰「黔首」。同天下書。分為三十六郡。
cells.literal: Year 27 changed the name of the Yellow River to 'De Water'. Made twelve golden statues. Called the people 'Black Heads'. Unified the writing system of all under heaven. Divided into thirty-six commanderies.
cells.idiomatic: In the twenty-seventh year, the Yellow River was renamed 'De Water'. Twelve golden statues were cast. The people were called 'Black Heads'. The writing system of all under heaven was unified. The empire was divided into thirty-six commanderies.

cells.content: 二十八為阿房宮。之衡山。治馳道。帝之琅邪，道南郡入。為太極廟。賜戶三十，爵一級。
cells.literal: Year 28 built the Epang Palace. Went to Mount Heng. Repaired the imperial roads. The emperor went to Langye, entered via Nanhai commandery. Built the Taiji Temple. Granted thirty households, ennobled by one rank.
cells.idiomatic: In the twenty-eighth year, the Epang Palace was built. He went to Mount Heng. The imperial roads were repaired. The emperor went to Langye, entering via Nanhai commandery. The Taiji Temple was built. Thirty households were granted, ennobled by one rank.

cells.content: 二十九郡縣大索十日。帝之琅邪，道上黨入。
cells.literal: Year 29 great search in commanderies and counties for ten days. The emperor went to Langye, entered via Shangdang.
cells.idiomatic: In the twenty-ninth year, there was a great search in commanderies and counties for ten days. The emperor went to Langye, entering via Shangdang.

cells.content: 三十一更命臘曰「嘉平」。賜黔首里六石米二羊，以嘉平。大索二十日。
cells.literal: Year 31 changed the name of the winter sacrifice to 'Jiaping'. Granted Black Heads in each neighborhood six bushels of rice and two sheep for Jiaping. Great search for twenty days.
cells.idiomatic: In the thirty-first year, the winter sacrifice was renamed 'Jiaping'. Black Heads in each neighborhood were granted six bushels of rice and two sheep for Jiaping. There was a great search for twenty days.

cells.content: 三十二帝之碣石，道上郡入。
cells.literal: Year 32 the emperor went to Jieshi, entered via Shang commandery.
cells.idiomatic: In the thirty-second year, the emperor went to Jieshi, entering via Shang commandery.

cells.content: 三十三遣諸逋亡及賈人贅婿略取陸梁，為桂林、南海、象郡，以適戍。西北取戎為三十四縣。築長城河上，蒙恬將三十萬。
cells.literal: Year 33 sent various fugitives and merchants' sons-in-law to seize Luliang, established Guilin, Nanhai, Xiang commanderies to station troops. In the northwest took Rong territory to establish thirty-four counties. Built Great Wall along the Yellow River, Meng Tian commanded three hundred thousand.
cells.idiomatic: In the thirty-third year, various fugitives and merchants' sons-in-law were sent to seize Luliang. Guilin, Nanhai, and Xiang commanderies were established to station troops. In the northwest, Rong territory was taken to establish thirty-four counties. The Great Wall was built along the Yellow River, with Meng Tian commanding three hundred thousand troops.

cells.content: 三十四適治獄不直者築長城。取南方越地。覆獄故失。
cells.literal: Year 34 sent those who handled legal cases unjustly to build the Great Wall. Took southern Yue territory. Reviewed legal cases and pardoned errors.
cells.idiomatic: In the thirty-fourth year, those who handled legal cases unjustly were sent to build the Great Wall. Southern Yue territory was taken. Legal cases were reviewed and errors pardoned.

cells.content: 三十五為直道，道九原，通甘泉。
cells.literal: Year 35 built the Straight Road, from Jiuyuan, connecting to Ganquan.
cells.idiomatic: In the thirty-fifth year, the Straight Road was built from Jiuyuan, connecting to Ganquan.

cells.content: 三十六徙民於北河、榆中，耐徙三處，拜爵一級。石畫下東郡，有文言「地分。」
cells.literal: Year 36 moved people to Beih River and Yuzhong, those who endured moving to three places were ennobled by one rank. Stone inscription fell in Dong commandery, with writing that said 'The earth divides.'
cells.idiomatic: In the thirty-sixth year, people were moved to the Beih River and Yuzhong areas. Those who endured moving to three places were ennobled by one rank. A stone inscription fell in Dong commandery, bearing the words 'The earth divides.'

cells.content: 三十七十月，帝之會稽、琅邪，還至沙丘崩。子胡亥立，為二世皇帝。殺蒙恬。道九原入。復行錢。
cells.literal: Year 37 tenth month, the emperor went to Kuaiji and Langye, on return to Shaqiu he collapsed. Son Hu Hai ascended, became Second Generation emperor. Killed Meng Tian. Entered via Jiuyuan. Resumed circulating coins.
cells.idiomatic: In the thirty-seventh year, tenth month, the emperor went to Kuaiji and Langye. On his return to Shaqiu, he collapsed. His son Hu Hai ascended the throne and became the Second Generation emperor. Meng Tian was killed. He entered via Jiuyuan. Coin circulation was resumed.

cells.content: 二世元年十月戊寅，大赦罪人。十一月，為兔園。十二月，就阿房宮。其九月，郡縣皆反。楚兵至戲，章邯擊卻之。出衛君角為庶人。
cells.literal: Second Generation first year tenth month Wuchen day, great amnesty for criminals. Eleventh month, made Rabbit Garden. Twelfth month, moved to Epang Palace. In the ninth month, commanderies and counties all rebelled. Chu troops reached Xi, Zhang Han attacked and drove them back. Exiled Wei Lord Jiao as commoner.
cells.idiomatic: In the first year of the Second Generation, tenth month, Wuchen day, there was a great amnesty for criminals. In the eleventh month, the Rabbit Garden was created. In the twelfth month, he moved to the Epang Palace. In the ninth month, all commanderies and counties rebelled. Chu troops reached Xi, but Zhang Han attacked and drove them back. Wei Lord Jiao was exiled as a commoner.

cells.content: 二將軍章邯、長史司馬欣、都尉董翳追楚兵至河。誅丞相斯、去疾，將軍馮劫。
cells.literal: Two generals Zhang Han and Chief Scribe Sima Xin, Colonel Dong Yi pursued Chu troops to the river. Executed Chancellor Li Si and Qu Ji, General Feng Jie.
cells.idiomatic: The two generals Zhang Han and Chief Scribe Sima Xin, along with Colonel Dong Yi, pursued the Chu troops to the river. Chancellor Li Si and Qu Ji were executed, as was General Feng Jie.

cells.content: 三趙高反，二世自殺，高立二世兄子嬰。子嬰立，剌殺高，夷三族。諸侯入秦，嬰降，為項羽所殺。尋誅羽，天下屬漢。
cells.literal: Zhao Gao rebelled, Second Generation committed suicide, Gao established Second Generation's nephew Zi Ying. Zi Ying ascended, assassinated Gao, exterminated three clans. Feudal lords entered Qin, Zi Ying surrendered, was killed by Xiang Yu. Soon Yu was executed, all under heaven belonged to Han.
cells.idiomatic: Zhao Gao rebelled. The Second Generation emperor committed suicide. Gao established Zi Ying, the nephew of the Second Generation emperor. Zi Ying ascended the throne, assassinated Gao, and exterminated his three clans. The feudal lords entered Qin. Zi Ying surrendered but was killed by Xiang Yu. Soon after, Yu was executed, and all under heaven came under Han rule.
